Câu hỏi 1121: Marketing is managing profitable customer relationships.
Câu trả lời 1121: Marketing involves creating, communicating, and delivering value to customers, which helps in building and maintaining profitable relationships with them. 

Câu hỏi 1122: According to management guru Peter Drucker, "The aim of marketing is to ________."
A) maximize profits of the company
B) emphasize customer wants and not customer needs
C) make selling unnecessary
D) fulfill unrealistic customer expectations
E) sell products
Câu trả lời 1122: Peter Drucker was a management consultant, educator, and author who is considered to be the father of modern management. According to Drucker, the aim of marketing is to make selling unnecessary. This means that the goal of marketing is to understand and satisfy the needs and wants of customers so well that the product or service sells itself. By understanding and meeting the needs of customers, a company can build a loyal customer base and achieve long-term success. Drucker believed that marketing is a key driver of business success, and that companies must constantly innovate and adapt their marketing strategies to stay competitive. Maximizing profits, emphasizing customer wants over needs, and fulfilling unrealistic customer expectations are not the primary objectives of marketing, according to Drucker. While selling products is certainly an important part of the marketing process, it is not the ultimate goal. 

Câu hỏi 1123: Greg Williams now has the buying power to purchase the desktop computer that he has wanted for the last six months. Greg's want now has become a(n) ________.
A) need
B) necessity
C) demand
D) exchange
E) transaction
Câu trả lời 1123: The statement mentions that Greg has the buying power to purchase a desktop computer that he has wanted for the last six months. This indicates that Greg has developed a desire or willingness to buy a desktop computer, which is referred to as a demand in economics. Demand refers to the quantity of a product or service that consumers are willing and able to buy at a given price, over a specific period of time. Therefore, in this case, Greg's want for a desktop computer has translated into a demand, as he has the purchasing power to buy it. Options A, B, D, and E are not appropriate choices, as they do not accurately describe the situation presented in the statement. 

Câu hỏi 1124: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, a company should ________ before designing a customer-driven marketing strategy.
A) determine how to deliver superior value to customers
B) build profitable relationships with customers
C) use customer relationship management to create full partnerships with key customers
D) understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants
E) construct an integrated marketing program
Câu trả lời 1124: The five-step model of the marketing process includes the following steps:
Understanding the marketplace and customer needs and wants
Designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
Constructing an integrated marketing program
Building customer relationships
Capturing value from customers
The first step in the process is to understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants. This involves conducting market research, analyzing customer behavior and preferences, and identifying trends in the industry. Only after this step can a company design a customer-driven marketing strategy that meets the needs and wants of their target audience. Therefore, option D is the correct choice.
Option A is incorrect because determining how to deliver superior value to customers is a part of designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, which is step 2. Option B is incorrect because building profitable relationships with customers is step 4, after the marketing strategy has been designed. Option C is incorrect because customer relationship management (CRM) is a tool used to build and maintain customer relationships, which is step 4 in the marketing process. Option E is incorrect because constructing an integrated marketing program is step 3, which comes after designing a customer-driven marketing strategy. 

Câu hỏi 1125: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, which of the following is the final step in creating value for customers?
A) designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
B) understanding the marketplace and customer needs
C) constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value
D) building profitable relationships and creating customer delight
E) capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity
Câu trả lời 1125: The five-step model of the marketing process includes understanding the marketplace and customer needs, designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value, building profitable relationships and creating customer delight, and capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity.
The final step in the process is capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity. This involves creating a pricing strategy that allows the company to capture the value it has provided to customers while also creating a strong relationship with those customers that will lead to future purchases and loyalty. In this step, the company evaluates the effectiveness of its marketing efforts and adjusts its strategies based on customer feedback and market trends to continue to create value for its customers and capture value for itself. 

Câu hỏi 1126: When backed by buying power, wants become ________.
A) social needs
B) demands
C) physical needs
D) self-esteem needs
E) exchanges
Câu trả lời 1126: When a want is backed by buying power, it becomes a demand. A want is simply a desire or aspiration for something, but a demand is a want that is supported by the ability and willingness to pay for it. In other words, when someone has the financial resources and the willingness to spend those resources on a particular want, that want becomes a demand. For example, a person may want a new car, but it only becomes a demand when they have the financial means and the intention to purchase a new car. Therefore, the best choice to complete the sentence is option B) demands. 

Câu hỏi 1127: Which of the following terms refers to sellers being preoccupied with their own products and losing sight of underlying consumer needs?
A) vendor lock-in
B) social loafing
C) value proposition
D) marketing myopia
E) conspicuous consumption
Câu trả lời 1127: Marketing myopia is a term used to describe when sellers become overly focused on their own products and lose sight of the underlying needs and desires of consumers. This can lead to a failure to adapt to changing market conditions and consumer preferences, which can ultimately result in decreased sales and revenue. Other terms on the list have different meanings:
Vendor lock-in refers to a situation where a customer becomes dependent on a particular vendor's products or services and is therefore less likely to switch to another vendor.
Social loafing refers to the tendency for individuals to exert less effort when working in a group than when working alone.
Value proposition refers to the unique benefits that a product or service offers to consumers, which distinguish it from competitors.
Conspicuous consumption refers to the act of purchasing and displaying expensive goods or services in order to signal social status or wealth. 

Câu hỏi 1128: Refer to the scenario below to answer the following question(s).
Carol Veldt, owner of Seagull Terrace, watched her investment grow from a small, seaside motel to a thriving year-round resort in just a few years. Atop a cliff overlooking the Maine coast, Seagull Terrace had attracted thousands of visitors during summer, but then faced a tremendous downturn in business during winter. "But, given the established industries in the nearby towns, very little year-round competition, and our close proximity to Portland," Carol added, "I couldn't understand why seasonality had to hit Seagull Terrace so hard!"
So Carol spent her first winter devising a new marketing plan. She put together a promotional package designed to attract business travelers year-round. Carol's plan also involved a seasonal promotional gimmick-to be implemented from early winter to late spring-that would attract the same numbers as the large summer crowd. Her idea worked! During her second winter, Carol greeted numerous business travelers-both satisfied repeat guests as well as new guests who had been snagged by her promotional appeals.
"We still have a long way to go," Carol admitted. "Our delicatessen offers entrees that are a part of the local cuisine, but we'd like to expand that. We provide health club privileges off-site, but we'd like to eventually provide our own. These are goals I hope to achieve in a few years. Our first project, however, included a renovation of our guest rooms and I'm quite proud of the results." Carol then added, "Actually there are so many possibilities. With an indoor pool area, I will eventually offer weekend getaways throughout winter."
-Seagull Terrace offers its customers good accommodations, local delicacies, and amazing seaside views. The overall experience provided at the motel is a part of its ________.
A) market offering
B) target market
C) market segment
D) product positioning
E) marketing mix
Câu trả lời 1128: Market offering refers to the combination of products and services that a business offers to meet the needs of its target market. Seagull Terrace offers good accommodations, local delicacies, and amazing seaside views as part of its market offering. While target market, market segment, product positioning, and marketing mix are all important concepts in marketing, they do not fully capture the range of products and services that Seagull Terrace offers to its customers. 

Câu hỏi 1129: A(n) ________ is the set of actual and potential buyers of a product or service.
A) market
B) control group
C) subsidiary
D) focus group
E) audience
Câu trả lời 1129: A market is defined as the set of actual and potential buyers of a product or service. This includes all individuals or organizations that have a need or desire for the product or service and have the ability to purchase it. The market may also include individuals or organizations who are not currently purchasing the product or service, but have the potential to do so in the future. Therefore, option A is the best choice as it provides the most accurate definition of a market. Option B (control group) refers to a group in an experiment that is used for comparison purposes, option C (subsidiary) refers to a company that is controlled by another company, option D (focus group) refers to a group of individuals who are asked to provide feedback on a product or service, and option E (audience) refers to the group of people who are watching, listening to, or reading a particular piece of media or content. 

Câu hỏi 1130: Human needs are shaped by culture and individual personality.
Câu trả lời 1130: The answer of Human needs are shaped by culture and...

Câu hỏi 1131: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of ________.
A) disappointing loyal customers
B) having to use an outside-in rather than an inside-out perspective
C) failing to attract enough customers
D) failing to understand their customers' needs
E) incorrectly identifying a target market
Câu trả lời 1131: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, the marketer may convey a message to potential customers that the offering is not very good, leading them to look for alternatives. Customers may also perceive the product or service as being of low quality, which may make it difficult for the marketer to differentiate it from competitors. Additionally, setting low expectations may limit the potential revenue the offering can generate, as customers may not be willing to pay as much for something that they perceive to be of lower value. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic expectations for their offerings that accurately reflect their value proposition and meet the needs of their target market. When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, they may communicate a message that the product or service is not very valuable, which may result in potential customers looking elsewhere for a better option. Additionally, setting low expectations may also result in missed opportunities to differentiate the offering and position it more effectively in the marketplace. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic but compelling expectations that will attract and retain customers. 

Câu hỏi 1132: Which of the following is NOT an accurate description of modern marketing?
A) Marketing is the creation of value for customers.
B) Marketing involves managing profitable customer relationships.
C) Marketing emphasizes selling and advertising exclusively.
D) Marketing involves satisfying customers' needs.
E) Marketing is building value-laden exchange relationships with customers.
Câu trả lời 1132: Modern marketing is not solely focused on selling and advertising; it encompasses a broader approach that includes creating value, managing relationships, and satisfying customer needs. 

Câu hỏi 1133: Needs include all of the following EXCEPT ________.
A) food
B) knowledge
C) affection
D) the newest iphone
E) belonging
Câu trả lời 1133: The newest iPhone is not a need, but a want. 

Câu hỏi 1134: The difference between human needs and wants is that needs are not created by marketers.
Câu trả lời 1134: Human needs are basic requirements for survival and well-being, such as food, water, and shelter, and exist independently of marketing efforts. Wants, however, are shaped by culture, society, and marketing, reflecting desires for specific products or services. 

Câu hỏi 1135: ________ is the act of obtaining a desired object from someone by offering something in return.
A) Valuation
B) Exchange
C) Market offering
D) Confiscation
E) Donation
Câu trả lời 1135: Exchange is the act of obtaining a desired object from someone by offering something in return. It is a fundamental concept in economics and is the basis for market transactions. In an exchange, both parties believe that they will benefit from the transaction, otherwise, they would not engage in it. The other options, such as valuation, confiscation, and donation, do not involve the mutual agreement and consent of both parties and therefore do not constitute an exchange. Market offering refers to the products or services being offered for sale in a marketplace, but it is not the same as the act of exchange itself. 

Câu hỏi 1136: Consumer research, product development, communication, distribution, pricing, and service are all core ________ activities.
A) positioning
B) marketing
C) outsourcing
D) production
E) logistics
Câu trả lời 1136: Consumer research, product development, communication, distribution, pricing, and service are all core marketing activities. Marketing is the process of identifying, anticipating, and satisfying customer needs and wants through the creation, promotion, and distribution of goods and services. The six activities listed are fundamental components of the marketing mix, which is the set of tactical tools that marketers use to create a desired response from their target market.
Positioning refers to the process of creating a distinctive image or identity for a product or brand in the minds of consumers. Outsourcing refers to the practice of hiring an external company to perform a business function that is normally done in-house. Production refers to the process of creating goods or services. Logistics refers to the process of managing the flow of goods from the point of origin to the point of consumption. While all of these activities may be important for a business, they are not considered core marketing activities. 

Câu hỏi 1137: ________ are human needs that are shaped by culture and individual personality.
A) Necessities
B) Wants
C) Demands
D) Values
E) Exchanges
Câu trả lời 1137: Wants are human needs that are influenced and shaped by cultural and individual factors, distinguishing them from basic necessities. 

Câu hỏi 1138: Marketing is defined as a social and managerial process by which individuals and organizations obtain what they need and want through ________.
A) research and development
B) innovation and creativity
C) manufacturing efficiencies
D) value creation and exchange
E) sales and revenue creation
Câu trả lời 1138: Marketing is the process of creating value for customers and exchanging that value for their satisfaction. It involves identifying customer needs and wants, developing products and services that meet those needs and wants, and communicating the benefits of those products and services to the target audience. The ultimate goal of marketing is to create and maintain long-term customer relationships that result in repeat business and customer loyalty. While research and development, innovation and creativity, manufacturing efficiencies, and sales and revenue creation are important components of marketing, they are all ultimately geared towards creating value for customers and exchanging that value for customer satisfaction. 

Câu hỏi 1139: A ________ is some combination of products, services, information, or experiences provided to consumers to satisfy a need or want.
A) market offering
B) value proposition
C) brand positioning
D) market segment
E) market mix
Câu trả lời 1139: A market offering refers to a bundle of products, services, information, or experiences that are presented to consumers to fulfill a particular need or want. It is a package of value that a company provides to its target customers to create customer satisfaction and loyalty. Market offerings can be tangible goods, intangible services, digital products, or a combination of all. They can be customized according to the needs and preferences of different market segments. Market offerings are the core of a company's marketing strategy and are designed to meet the specific needs of the target market. 

Câu hỏi 1140: When are sellers most effective?
A) when they focus more on their specific products and services
B) when they focus more on the price of their products and services
C) when they focus more on the benefits and experiences produced by their products and services
D) when they focus more on where their products and services can be purchased
E) when they focus more on cost to produce the product or service
Câu trả lời 1140: Sellers are most effective when they focus more on the benefits and experiences produced by their products and services. Customers are generally looking for solutions to their problems or desires, and they are willing to pay for products or services that can provide those solutions. By highlighting the benefits and experiences that their products or services can provide, sellers can show customers how their offerings can meet their needs and improve their lives.
While it is important for sellers to have a good understanding of the price and cost of their products or services, focusing solely on these factors can be limiting. Customers are often willing to pay more for products or services that provide greater benefits or experiences. Similarly, while the availability of a product or service is important, focusing solely on where it can be purchased is unlikely to be the most effective approach for most sellers.
Overall, by emphasizing the benefits and experiences produced by their products or services, sellers can more effectively connect with customers and demonstrate the value of their offerings. 

Câu hỏi 1141: Marketing is managing profitable customer relationships.
Câu trả lời 1141: Marketing involves creating, communicating, and delivering value to customers, which helps in building and maintaining profitable relationships with them. 

Câu hỏi 1142: According to management guru Peter Drucker, "The aim of marketing is to ________."
A) maximize profits of the company
B) emphasize customer wants and not customer needs
C) make selling unnecessary
D) fulfill unrealistic customer expectations
E) sell products
Câu trả lời 1142: Peter Drucker was a management consultant, educator, and author who is considered to be the father of modern management. According to Drucker, the aim of marketing is to make selling unnecessary. This means that the goal of marketing is to understand and satisfy the needs and wants of customers so well that the product or service sells itself. By understanding and meeting the needs of customers, a company can build a loyal customer base and achieve long-term success. Drucker believed that marketing is a key driver of business success, and that companies must constantly innovate and adapt their marketing strategies to stay competitive. Maximizing profits, emphasizing customer wants over needs, and fulfilling unrealistic customer expectations are not the primary objectives of marketing, according to Drucker. While selling products is certainly an important part of the marketing process, it is not the ultimate goal. 

Câu hỏi 1143: Greg Williams now has the buying power to purchase the desktop computer that he has wanted for the last six months. Greg's want now has become a(n) ________.
A) need
B) necessity
C) demand
D) exchange
E) transaction
Câu trả lời 1143: The statement mentions that Greg has the buying power to purchase a desktop computer that he has wanted for the last six months. This indicates that Greg has developed a desire or willingness to buy a desktop computer, which is referred to as a demand in economics. Demand refers to the quantity of a product or service that consumers are willing and able to buy at a given price, over a specific period of time. Therefore, in this case, Greg's want for a desktop computer has translated into a demand, as he has the purchasing power to buy it. Options A, B, D, and E are not appropriate choices, as they do not accurately describe the situation presented in the statement. 

Câu hỏi 1144: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, a company should ________ before designing a customer-driven marketing strategy.
A) determine how to deliver superior value to customers
B) build profitable relationships with customers
C) use customer relationship management to create full partnerships with key customers
D) understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants
E) construct an integrated marketing program
Câu trả lời 1144: The five-step model of the marketing process includes the following steps:
Understanding the marketplace and customer needs and wants
Designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
Constructing an integrated marketing program
Building customer relationships
Capturing value from customers
The first step in the process is to understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants. This involves conducting market research, analyzing customer behavior and preferences, and identifying trends in the industry. Only after this step can a company design a customer-driven marketing strategy that meets the needs and wants of their target audience. Therefore, option D is the correct choice.
Option A is incorrect because determining how to deliver superior value to customers is a part of designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, which is step 2. Option B is incorrect because building profitable relationships with customers is step 4, after the marketing strategy has been designed. Option C is incorrect because customer relationship management (CRM) is a tool used to build and maintain customer relationships, which is step 4 in the marketing process. Option E is incorrect because constructing an integrated marketing program is step 3, which comes after designing a customer-driven marketing strategy. 

Câu hỏi 1145: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, which of the following is the final step in creating value for customers?
A) designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
B) understanding the marketplace and customer needs
C) constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value
D) building profitable relationships and creating customer delight
E) capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity
Câu trả lời 1145: The five-step model of the marketing process includes understanding the marketplace and customer needs, designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value, building profitable relationships and creating customer delight, and capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity.
The final step in the process is capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity. This involves creating a pricing strategy that allows the company to capture the value it has provided to customers while also creating a strong relationship with those customers that will lead to future purchases and loyalty. In this step, the company evaluates the effectiveness of its marketing efforts and adjusts its strategies based on customer feedback and market trends to continue to create value for its customers and capture value for itself. 

Câu hỏi 1146: When backed by buying power, wants become ________.
A) social needs
B) demands
C) physical needs
D) self-esteem needs
E) exchanges
Câu trả lời 1146: When a want is backed by buying power, it becomes a demand. A want is simply a desire or aspiration for something, but a demand is a want that is supported by the ability and willingness to pay for it. In other words, when someone has the financial resources and the willingness to spend those resources on a particular want, that want becomes a demand. For example, a person may want a new car, but it only becomes a demand when they have the financial means and the intention to purchase a new car. Therefore, the best choice to complete the sentence is option B) demands. 

Câu hỏi 1147: Which of the following terms refers to sellers being preoccupied with their own products and losing sight of underlying consumer needs?
A) vendor lock-in
B) social loafing
C) value proposition
D) marketing myopia
E) conspicuous consumption
Câu trả lời 1147: Marketing myopia is a term used to describe when sellers become overly focused on their own products and lose sight of the underlying needs and desires of consumers. Vendor lock-in refers to a situation where a customer becomes dependent on a particular vendor's products or services and is therefore less likely to switch to another vendor.
Social loafing refers to the tendency for individuals to exert less effort when working in a group than when working alone.
Value proposition refers to the unique benefits that a product or service offers to consumers, which distinguish it from competitors.
Conspicuous consumption refers to the act of purchasing and displaying expensive goods or services in order to signal social status or wealth. 

Câu hỏi 1148: Refer to the scenario below to answer the following question(s).
Carol Veldt, owner of Seagull Terrace, watched her investment grow from a small, seaside motel to a thriving year-round resort in just a few years. Atop a cliff overlooking the Maine coast, Seagull Terrace had attracted thousands of visitors during summer, but then faced a tremendous downturn in business during winter. "But, given the established industries in the nearby towns, very little year-round competition, and our close proximity to Portland," Carol added, "I couldn't understand why seasonality had to hit Seagull Terrace so hard!"
So Carol spent her first winter devising a new marketing plan. She put together a promotional package designed to attract business travelers year-round. Carol's plan also involved a seasonal promotional gimmick-to be implemented from early winter to late spring-that would attract the same numbers as the large summer crowd. Her idea worked! During her second winter, Carol greeted numerous business travelers-both satisfied repeat guests as well as new guests who had been snagged by her promotional appeals.
"We still have a long way to go," Carol admitted. "Our delicatessen offers entrees that are a part of the local cuisine, but we'd like to expand that. We provide health club privileges off-site, but we'd like to eventually provide our own. These are goals I hope to achieve in a few years. Our first project, however, included a renovation of our guest rooms and I'm quite proud of the results." Carol then added, "Actually there are so many possibilities. With an indoor pool area, I will eventually offer weekend getaways throughout winter."
-Seagull Terrace offers its customers good accommodations, local delicacies, and amazing seaside views. The overall experience provided at the motel is a part of its ________.
A) market offering
B) target market
C) market segment
D) product positioning
E) marketing mix
Câu trả lời 1148: Market offering refers to the combination of products and services that a business offers to meet the needs of its target market. While target market, market segment, product positioning, and marketing mix are all important concepts in marketing, they do not fully capture the range of products and services that Seagull Terrace offers to its customers.

A) market
B) control group
C) subsidiary
D) focus group
E) audience
Câu trả lời 1149: A market is defined as the set of actual and potential buyers of a product or service. This includes all individuals or organizations that have a need or desire for the product or service and have the ability to purchase it. The market may also include individuals or organizations who are not currently purchasing the product or service, but have the potential to do so in the future. Therefore, option A is the best choice as it provides the most accurate definition of a market. Option B (control group) refers to a group in an experiment that is used for comparison purposes, option C (subsidiary) refers to a company that is controlled by another company, option D (focus group) refers to a group of individuals who are asked to provide feedback on a product or service, and option E (audience) refers to the group of people who are watching, listening to, or reading a particular piece of media or content.

Câu hỏi 1151: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of ________.
A) disappointing loyal customers
B) having to use an outside-in rather than an inside-out perspective
C) failing to attract enough customers
D) failing to understand their customers' needs
E) incorrectly identifying a target market
Câu trả lời 1151: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, the marketer may convey a message to potential customers that the offering is not very good, leading them to look for alternatives. Customers may also perceive the product or service as being of low quality, which may make it difficult for the marketer to differentiate it from competitors. Additionally, setting low expectations may limit the potential revenue the offering can generate, as customers may not be willing to pay as much for something that they perceive to be of lower value. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic expectations for their offerings that accurately reflect their value proposition and meet the needs of their target market. When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, they may communicate a message that the product or service is not very valuable, which may result in potential customers looking elsewhere for a better option. Additionally, setting low expectations may also result in missed opportunities to differentiate the offering and position it more effectively in the marketplace. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic but compelling expectations that will attract and retain customers.

Câu hỏi 1155: ________ is the act of obtaining a desired object from someone by offering something in return.
A) Valuation
B) Exchange
C) Market offering
D) Confiscation
E) Donation
Câu trả lời 1155: Exchange is the act of obtaining a desired object from someone by offering something in return. It is a fundamental concept in economics and is the basis for market transactions. In an exchange, both parties believe that they will benefit from the transaction, otherwise, they would not engage in it. The other options, such as valuation, confiscation, and donation, do not involve the mutual agreement and consent of both parties and therefore do not constitute an exchange. Market offering refers to the products or services being offered for sale in a marketplace, but it is not the same as the act of exchange itself. 

Câu hỏi 1156: Consumer research, product development, communication, distribution, pricing, and service are all core ________ activities.
A) positioning
B) marketing
C) outsourcing
D) production
E) logistics
Câu trả lời 1156: Consumer research, product development, communication, distribution, pricing, and service are all core marketing activities. Marketing is the process of identifying, anticipating, and satisfying customer needs and wants through the creation, promotion, and distribution of goods and services. The six activities listed are fundamental components of the marketing mix, which is the set of tactical tools that marketers use to create a desired response from their target market.
Positioning refers to the process of creating a distinctive image or identity for a product or brand in the minds of consumers. Outsourcing refers to the practice of hiring an external company to perform a business function that is normally done in-house. Production refers to the process of creating goods or services. Logistics refers to the process of managing the flow of goods from the point of origin to the point of consumption. While all of these activities may be important for a business, they are not considered core marketing activities.

E) Exchanges
Câu trả lời 1157: Wants are human needs that are influenced and shaped by cultural and individual factors, distinguishing them from basic necessities. 

Câu hỏi 1158: Marketing is defined as a social and managerial process by which individuals and organizations obtain what they need and want through ________.
A) research and development
B) innovation and creativity
C) manufacturing efficiencies
D) value creation and exchange
E) sales and revenue creation
Câu trả lời 1158: Marketing is the process of creating value for customers and exchanging that value for their satisfaction. It involves identifying customer needs and wants, developing products and services that meet those needs and wants, and communicating the benefits of those products and services to the target audience. The ultimate goal of marketing is to create and maintain long-term customer relationships that result in repeat business and customer loyalty. While research and development, innovation and creativity, manufacturing efficiencies, and sales and revenue creation are important components of marketing, they are all ultimately geared towards creating value for customers and exchanging that value for customer satisfaction. 

Câu hỏi 1159: A ________ is some combination of products, services, information, or experiences provided to consumers to satisfy a need or want.
A) market offering
B) value proposition
C) brand positioning
D) market segment
E) market mix
Câu trả lời 1159: A market offering refers to a bundle of products, services, information, or experiences that are presented to consumers to fulfill a particular need or want. It is a package of value that a company provides to its target customers to create customer satisfaction and loyalty. Market offerings can be tangible goods, intangible services, digital products, or a combination of all. They can be customized according to the needs and preferences of different market segments. Market offerings are the core of a company's marketing strategy and are designed to meet the specific needs of the target market. 

Câu hỏi 1160: When are sellers most effective?
A) when they focus more on their specific products and services
B) when they focus more on the price of their products and services
C) when they focus more on the benefits and experiences produced by their products and services
D) when they focus more on where their products and services can be purchased
E) when they focus more on cost to produce the product or service
Câu trả lời 1160: Sellers are most effective when they focus more on the benefits and experiences produced by their products and services. Customers are generally looking for solutions to their problems or desires, and they are willing to pay for products or services that can provide those solutions. By highlighting the benefits and experiences that their products or services can provide, sellers can show customers how their offerings can meet their needs and improve their lives.
While it is important for sellers to have a good understanding of the price and cost of their products or services, focusing solely on these factors can be limiting. Customers are often willing to pay more for products or services that provide greater benefits or experiences. Similarly, while the availability of a product or service is important, focusing solely on where it can be purchased is unlikely to be the most effective approach for most sellers.
Overall, by emphasizing the benefits and experiences produced by their products or services, sellers can more effectively connect with customers and demonstrate the value of their offerings. 

Câu hỏi 1161: Marketing is managing profitable customer relationships.
Câu trả lời 1161: Marketing involves creating, communicating, and delivering value to customers, which helps in building and maintaining profitable relationships with them. 

Câu hỏi 1162: According to management guru Peter Drucker, "The aim of marketing is to ________."
A) maximize profits of the company
B) emphasize customer wants and not customer needs
C) make selling unnecessary
D) fulfill unrealistic customer expectations
E) sell products
Câu trả lời 1162: Peter Drucker was a management consultant, educator, and author who is considered to be the father of modern management. According to Drucker, the aim of marketing is to make selling unnecessary. This means that the goal of marketing is to understand and satisfy the needs and wants of customers so well that the product or service sells itself. By understanding and meeting the needs of customers, a company can build a loyal customer base and achieve long-term success. Drucker believed that marketing is a key driver of business success, and that companies must constantly innovate and adapt their marketing strategies to stay competitive. Maximizing profits, emphasizing customer wants over needs, and fulfilling unrealistic customer expectations are not the primary objectives of marketing, according to Drucker. While selling products is certainly an important part of the marketing process, it is not the ultimate goal. 

Câu hỏi 1163: Greg Williams now has the buying power to purchase the desktop computer that he has wanted for the last six months. Greg's want now has become a(n) ________.
A) need
B) necessity
C) demand
D) exchange
E) transaction
Câu trả lời 1163: The statement mentions that Greg has the buying power to purchase a desktop computer that he has wanted for the last six months. This indicates that Greg has developed a desire or willingness to buy a desktop computer, which is referred to as a demand in economics. Demand refers to the quantity of a product or service that consumers are willing and able to buy at a given price, over a specific period of time. Therefore, in this case, Greg's want for a desktop computer has translated into a demand, as he has the purchasing power to buy it. Options A, B, D, and E are not appropriate choices, as they do not accurately describe the situation presented in the statement. 

Câu hỏi 1164: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, a company should ________ before designing a customer-driven marketing strategy.
A) determine how to deliver superior value to customers
B) build profitable relationships with customers
C) use customer relationship management to create full partnerships with key customers
D) understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants
E) construct an integrated marketing program
Câu trả lời 1164: The five-step model of the marketing process includes the following steps:
Understanding the marketplace and customer needs and wants
Designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
Constructing an integrated marketing program
Building customer relationships
Capturing value from customers
The first step in the process is to understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants. This involves conducting market research, analyzing customer behavior and preferences, and identifying trends in the industry. Only after this step can a company design a customer-driven marketing strategy that meets the needs and wants of their target audience. Therefore, option D is the correct choice.
Option A is incorrect because determining how to deliver superior value to customers is a part of designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, which is step 2. Option B is incorrect because building profitable relationships with customers is step 4, after the marketing strategy has been designed. Option C is incorrect because customer relationship management (CRM) is a tool used to build and maintain customer relationships, which is step 4 in the marketing process. Option E is incorrect because constructing an integrated marketing program is step 3, which comes after designing a customer-driven marketing strategy. 

Câu hỏi 1165: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, which of the following is the final step in creating value for customers?
A) designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
B) understanding the marketplace and customer needs
C) constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value
D) building profitable relationships and creating customer delight
E) capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity
Câu trả lời 1165: The five-step model of the marketing process includes understanding the marketplace and customer needs, designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value, building profitable relationships and creating customer delight, and capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity.
The final step in the process is capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity. This involves creating a pricing strategy that allows the company to capture the value it has provided to customers while also creating a strong relationship with those customers that will lead to future purchases and loyalty. In this step, the company evaluates the effectiveness of its marketing efforts and adjusts its strategies based on customer feedback and market trends to continue to create value for its customers and capture value for itself. 

Câu hỏi 1166: When backed by buying power, wants become ________.
A) social needs
B) demands
C) physical needs
D) self-esteem needs
E) exchanges
Câu trả lời 1166: When a want is backed by buying power, it becomes a demand. A want is simply a desire or aspiration for something, but a demand is a want that is supported by the ability and willingness to pay for it. In other words, when someone has the financial resources and the willingness to spend those resources on a particular want, that want becomes a demand. For example, a person may want a new car, but it only becomes a demand when they have the financial means and the intention to purchase a new car. Therefore, the best choice to complete the sentence is option B) demands. 

Câu hỏi 1167: Which of the following terms refers to sellers being preoccupied with their own products and losing sight of underlying consumer needs?
A) vendor lock-in
B) social loafing
C) value proposition
D) marketing myopia
E) conspicuous consumption
Câu trả lời 1167: Marketing myopia is a term used to describe when sellers become overly focused on their own products and lose sight of the underlying needs and desires of consumers. This can lead to a failure to adapt to changing market conditions and consumer preferences, which can ultimately result in decreased sales and revenue. Other terms on the list have different meanings:
Vendor lock-in refers to a situation where a customer becomes dependent on a particular vendor's products or services and is therefore less likely to switch to another vendor.
Social loafing refers to the tendency for individuals to exert less effort when working in a group than when working alone.
Value proposition refers to the unique benefits that a product or service offers to consumers, which distinguish it from competitors.
Conspicuous consumption refers to the act of purchasing and displaying expensive goods or services in order to signal social status or wealth. 

Câu hỏi 1168: Refer to the scenario below to answer the following question(s).
Carol Veldt, owner of Seagull Terrace, watched her investment grow from a small, seaside motel to a thriving year-round resort in just a few years. Atop a cliff overlooking the Maine coast, Seagull Terrace had attracted thousands of visitors during summer, but then faced a tremendous downturn in business during winter. "But, given the established industries in the nearby towns, very little year-round competition, and our close proximity to Portland," Carol added, "I couldn't understand why seasonality had to hit Seagull Terrace so hard!"
So Carol spent her first winter devising a new marketing plan. She put together a promotional package designed to attract business travelers year-round. Carol's plan also involved a seasonal promotional gimmick-to be implemented from early winter to late spring-that would attract the same numbers as the large summer crowd. Her idea worked! During her second winter, Carol greeted numerous business travelers-both satisfied repeat guests as well as new guests who had been snagged by her promotional appeals.
"We still have a long way to go," Carol admitted. "Our delicatessen offers entrees that are a part of the local cuisine, but we'd like to expand that. We provide health club privileges off-site, but we'd like to eventually provide our own. These are goals I hope to achieve in a few years. Our first project, however, included a renovation of our guest rooms and I'm quite proud of the results." Carol then added, "Actually there are so many possibilities. With an indoor pool area, I will eventually offer weekend getaways throughout winter."
-Seagull Terrace offers its customers good accommodations, local delicacies, and amazing seaside views. The overall experience provided at the motel is a part of its ________.
A) market offering
B) target market
C) market segment
D) product positioning
E) marketing mix
Câu trả lời 1168: Market offering refers to the combination of products and services that a business offers to meet the needs of its target market. Seagull Terrace offers good accommodations, local delicacies, and amazing seaside views as part of its market offering. While target market, market segment, product positioning, and marketing mix are all important concepts in marketing, they do not fully capture the range of products and services that Seagull Terrace offers to its customers. 

Câu hỏi 1169: A(n) ________ is the set of actual and potential buyers of a product or service.
A) market
B) control group
C) subsidiary
D) focus group
E) audience
Câu trả lời 1169: A market is defined as the set of actual and potential buyers of a product or service. This includes all individuals or organizations that have a need or desire for the product or service and have the ability to purchase it. The market may also include individuals or organizations who are not currently purchasing the product or service, but have the potential to do so in the future. Therefore, option A is the best choice as it provides the most accurate definition of a market. Option B (control group) refers to a group in an experiment that is used for comparison purposes, option C (subsidiary) refers to a company that is controlled by another company, option D (focus group) refers to a group of individuals who are asked to provide feedback on a product or service, and option E (audience) refers to the group of people who are watching, listening to, or reading a particular piece of media or content. 

Câu hỏi 1170: Human needs are shaped by culture and individual personality.
Câu trả lời 1170: The answer of Human needs are shaped by culture and...

Câu hỏi 1171: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of ________.
A) disappointing loyal customers
B) having to use an outside-in rather than an inside-out perspective
C) failing to attract enough customers
D) failing to understand their customers' needs
E) incorrectly identifying a target market
Câu trả lời 1171: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, the marketer may convey a message to potential customers that the offering is not very good, leading them to look for alternatives. Customers may also perceive the product or service as being of low quality, which may make it difficult for the marketer to differentiate it from competitors. Additionally, setting low expectations may limit the potential revenue the offering can generate, as customers may not be willing to pay as much for something that they perceive to be of lower value. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic expectations for their offerings that accurately reflect their value proposition and meet the needs of their target market. When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, they may communicate a message that the product or service is not very valuable, which may result in potential customers looking elsewhere for a better option. Additionally, setting low expectations may also result in missed opportunities to differentiate the offering and position it more effectively in the marketplace. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic but compelling expectations that will attract and retain customers. 

Câu hỏi 1172: Which of the following is NOT an accurate description of modern marketing?
A) Marketing is the creation of value for customers.
B) Marketing involves managing profitable customer relationships.
C) Marketing emphasizes selling and advertising exclusively.
D) Marketing involves satisfying customers' needs.
E) Marketing is building value-laden exchange relationships with customers.
Câu trả lời 1172: Modern marketing is not solely focused on selling and advertising; it encompasses a broader approach that includes creating value, managing relationships, and satisfying customer needs. 

Câu hỏi 1173: Needs include all of the following EXCEPT ________.
A) food
B) knowledge
C) affection
D) the newest iphone
E) belonging
Câu trả lời 1173: The newest iPhone is not a need, but a want. 

Câu hỏi 1174: The difference between human needs and wants is that needs are not created by marketers.
Câu trả lời 1174: Human needs are basic requirements for survival and well-being, such as food, water, and shelter, and exist independently of marketing efforts. Wants, however, are shaped by culture, society, and marketing, reflecting desires for specific products or services. 

Câu hỏi 1175: ________ is the act of obtaining a desired object from someone by offering something in return.
A) Valuation
B) Exchange
C) Market offering
D) Confiscation
E) Donation
Câu trả lời 1175: Exchange is the act of obtaining a desired object from someone by offering something in return. It is a fundamental concept in economics and is the basis for market transactions. In an exchange, both parties believe that they will benefit from the transaction, otherwise, they would not engage in it. The other options, such as valuation, confiscation, and donation, do not involve the mutual agreement and consent of both parties and therefore do not constitute an exchange. Market offering refers to the products or services being offered for sale in a marketplace, but it is not the same as the act of exchange itself. 

Câu hỏi 1176: Consumer research, product development, communication, distribution, pricing, and service are all core ________ activities.
A) positioning
B) marketing
C) outsourcing
D) production
E) logistics
Câu trả lời 1176: Consumer research, product development, communication, distribution, pricing, and service are all core marketing activities. Marketing is the process of identifying, anticipating, and satisfying customer needs and wants through the creation, promotion, and distribution of goods and services. The six activities listed are fundamental components of the marketing mix, which is the set of tactical tools that marketers use to create a desired response from their target market.
Positioning refers to the process of creating a distinctive image or identity for a product or brand in the minds of consumers. Outsourcing refers to the practice of hiring an external company to perform a business function that is normally done in-house. Production refers to the process of creating goods or services. Logistics refers to the process of managing the flow of goods from the point of origin to the point of consumption. While all of these activities may be important for a business, they are not considered core marketing activities. 

Câu hỏi 1177: ________ are human needs that are shaped by culture and individual personality.
A) Necessities
B) Wants
C) Demands
D) Values
E) Exchanges
Câu trả lời 1177: Wants are human needs that are influenced and shaped by cultural and individual factors, distinguishing them from basic necessities. 

Câu hỏi 1178: Marketing is defined as a social and managerial process by which individuals and organizations obtain what they need and want through ________.
A) research and development
B) innovation and creativity
C) manufacturing efficiencies
D) value creation and exchange
E) sales and revenue creation
Câu trả lời 1178: Marketing is the process of creating value for customers and exchanging that value for their satisfaction. The ultimate goal of marketing is to create and maintain long-term customer relationships that result in repeat business and customer loyalty. Market offerings are the core of a company's marketing strategy and are designed to meet the specific needs of the target market.

D) when they focus more on where their products and services can be purchased
E) when they focus more on cost to produce the product or service

D) understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants
E) construct an integrated marketing program

Câu hỏi 1185: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, which of the following is the final step in creating value for customers?
A) designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
B) understanding the marketplace and customer needs
C) constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value
D) building profitable relationships and creating customer delight
E) capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity
Câu trả lời 1185: The five-step model of the marketing process includes understanding the marketplace and customer needs, designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value, building profitable relationships and creating customer delight, and capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity.
The final step in the process is capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity. This involves creating a pricing strategy that allows the company to capture the value it has provided to customers while also creating a strong relationship with those customers that will lead to future purchases and loyalty. In this step, the company evaluates the effectiveness of its marketing efforts and adjusts its strategies based on customer feedback and market trends to continue to create value for its customers and capture value for itself.

Therefore, the best choice to complete the sentence is option B) demands.

Câu hỏi 1191: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of ________.
A) disappointing loyal customers
B) having to use an outside-in rather than an inside-out perspective
C) failing to attract enough customers
D) failing to understand their customers' needs
E) incorrectly identifying a target market
Câu trả lời 1191: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, the marketer may convey a message to potential customers that the offering is not very good, leading them to look for alternatives. Customers may also perceive the product or service as being of low quality, which may make it difficult for the marketer to differentiate it from competitors. Additionally, setting low expectations may limit the potential revenue the offering can generate, as customers may not be willing to pay as much for something that they perceive to be of lower value. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic expectations for their offerings that accurately reflect their value proposition and meet the needs of their target market. When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, they may communicate a message that the product or service is not very valuable, which may result in potential customers looking elsewhere for a better option. Additionally, setting low expectations may also result in missed opportunities to differentiate the offering and position it more effectively in the marketplace. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic but compelling expectations that will attract and retain customers. 

Câu hỏi 1192: Which of the following is NOT an accurate description of modern marketing?
A) Marketing is the creation of value for customers.
B) Marketing involves managing profitable customer relationships.
C) Marketing emphasizes selling and advertising exclusively.
D) Marketing involves satisfying customers' needs.
E) Marketing is building value-laden exchange relationships with customers.
Câu trả lời 1192: Modern marketing is not solely focused on selling and advertising; it encompasses a broader approach that includes creating value, managing relationships, and satisfying customer needs. 

Câu hỏi 1193: Needs include all of the following EXCEPT ________.
A) food
B) knowledge
C) affection
D) the newest iphone
E) belonging
Câu trả lời 1193: The newest iPhone is not a need, but a want. 

Câu hỏi 1194: The difference between human needs and wants is that needs are not created by marketers.
Câu trả lời 1194: Human needs are basic requirements for survival and well-being, such as food, water, and shelter, and exist independently of marketing efforts. Wants, however, are shaped by culture, society, and marketing, reflecting desires for specific products or services. 

Câu hỏi 1195: ________ is the act of obtaining a desired object from someone by offering something in return.
A) Valuation
B) Exchange
C) Market offering
D) Confiscation
E) Donation
Câu trả lời 1195: Exchange is the act of obtaining a desired object from someone by offering something in return. It is a fundamental concept in economics and is the basis for market transactions. In an exchange, both parties believe that they will benefit from the transaction, otherwise, they would not engage in it. The other options, such as valuation, confiscation, and donation, do not involve the mutual agreement and consent of both parties and therefore do not constitute an exchange. Market offering refers to the products or services being offered for sale in a marketplace, but it is not the same as the act of exchange itself. 

Câu hỏi 1196: Consumer research, product development, communication, distribution, pricing, and service are all core ________ activities.
A) positioning
B) marketing
C) outsourcing
D) production
E) logistics
Câu trả lời 1196: Consumer research, product development, communication, distribution, pricing, and service are all core marketing activities. Marketing is the process of identifying, anticipating, and satisfying customer needs and wants through the creation, promotion, and distribution of goods and services. The six activities listed are fundamental components of the marketing mix, which is the set of tactical tools that marketers use to create a desired response from their target market.
Positioning refers to the process of creating a distinctive image or identity for a product or brand in the minds of consumers. Outsourcing refers to the practice of hiring an external company to perform a business function that is normally done in-house. Production refers to the process of creating goods or services. Logistics refers to the process of managing the flow of goods from the point of origin to the point of consumption. While all of these activities may be important for a business, they are not considered core marketing activities. 

Câu hỏi 1197: ________ are human needs that are shaped by culture and individual personality.
A) Necessities
B) Wants
C) Demands
D) Values
E) Exchanges
Câu trả lời 1197: Wants are human needs that are influenced and shaped by cultural and individual factors, distinguishing them from basic necessities. 

Câu hỏi 1198: Marketing is defined as a social and managerial process by which individuals and organizations obtain what they need and want through ________.
A) research and development
B) innovation and creativity
C) manufacturing efficiencies
D) value creation and exchange
E) sales and revenue creation
Câu trả lời 1198: Marketing is the process of creating value for customers and exchanging that value for their satisfaction. It involves identifying customer needs and wants, developing products and services that meet those needs and wants, and communicating the benefits of those products and services to the target audience. The ultimate goal of marketing is to create and maintain long-term customer relationships that result in repeat business and customer loyalty. While research and development, innovation and creativity, manufacturing efficiencies, and sales and revenue creation are important components of marketing, they are all ultimately geared towards creating value for customers and exchanging that value for customer satisfaction. 

Câu hỏi 1199: A ________ is some combination of products, services, information, or experiences provided to consumers to satisfy a need or want.
A) market offering
B) value proposition
C) brand positioning
D) market segment
E) market mix
Câu trả lời 1199: A market offering refers to a bundle of products, services, information, or experiences that are presented to consumers to fulfill a particular need or want. It is a package of value that a company provides to its target customers to create customer satisfaction and loyalty. Market offerings can be tangible goods, intangible services, digital products, or a combination of all. They can be customized according to the needs and preferences of different market segments. Market offerings are the core of a company's marketing strategy and are designed to meet the specific needs of the target market. 

Câu hỏi 1200: When are sellers most effective?
A) when they focus more on their specific products and services
B) when they focus more on the price of their products and services
C) when they focus more on the benefits and experiences produced by their products and services
D) when they focus more on where their products and services can be purchased
E) when they focus more on cost to produce the product or service
Câu trả lời 1200: Sellers are most effective when they focus more on the benefits and experiences produced by their products and services. Customers are generally looking for solutions to their problems or desires, and they are willing to pay for products or services that can provide those solutions. By highlighting the benefits and experiences that their products or services can provide, sellers can show customers how their offerings can meet their needs and improve their lives.
While it is important for sellers to have a good understanding of the price and cost of their products or services, focusing solely on these factors can be limiting. Customers are often willing to pay more for products or services that provide greater benefits or experiences. Similarly, while the availability of a product or service is important, focusing solely on where it can be purchased is unlikely to be the most effective approach for most sellers.
Overall, by emphasizing the benefits and experiences produced by their products or services, sellers can more effectively connect with customers and demonstrate the value of their offerings. 

Câu hỏi 1201: Marketing is managing profitable customer relationships.
Câu trả lời 1201: Marketing involves creating, communicating, and delivering value to customers, which helps in building and maintaining profitable relationships with them. 

Câu hỏi 1202: According to management guru Peter Drucker, "The aim of marketing is to ________."
A) maximize profits of the company
B) emphasize customer wants and not customer needs
C) make selling unnecessary
D) fulfill unrealistic customer expectations
E) sell products
Câu trả lời 1202: Peter Drucker was a management consultant, educator, and author who is considered to be the father of modern management. According to Drucker, the aim of marketing is to make selling unnecessary. This means that the goal of marketing is to understand and satisfy the needs and wants of customers so well that the product or service sells itself. By understanding and meeting the needs of customers, a company can build a loyal customer base and achieve long-term success. Drucker believed that marketing is a key driver of business success, and that companies must constantly innovate and adapt their marketing strategies to stay competitive. Maximizing profits, emphasizing customer wants over needs, and fulfilling unrealistic customer expectations are not the primary objectives of marketing, according to Drucker. While selling products is certainly an important part of the marketing process, it is not the ultimate goal. 

Câu hỏi 1203: Greg Williams now has the buying power to purchase the desktop computer that he has wanted for the last six months. Greg's want now has become a(n) ________.
A) need
B) necessity
C) demand
D) exchange
E) transaction
Câu trả lời 1203: The statement mentions that Greg has the buying power to purchase a desktop computer that he has wanted for the last six months. This indicates that Greg has developed a desire or willingness to buy a desktop computer, which is referred to as a demand in economics. Demand refers to the quantity of a product or service that consumers are willing and able to buy at a given price, over a specific period of time. Therefore, in this case, Greg's want for a desktop computer has translated into a demand, as he has the purchasing power to buy it. Options A, B, D, and E are not appropriate choices, as they do not accurately describe the situation presented in the statement. 

Câu hỏi 1204: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, a company should ________ before designing a customer-driven marketing strategy.
A) determine how to deliver superior value to customers
B) build profitable relationships with customers
C) use customer relationship management to create full partnerships with key customers
D) understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants
E) construct an integrated marketing program
Câu trả lời 1204: The five-step model of the marketing process includes the following steps:
Understanding the marketplace and customer needs and wants
Designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
Constructing an integrated marketing program
Building customer relationships
Capturing value from customers
The first step in the process is to understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants. This involves conducting market research, analyzing customer behavior and preferences, and identifying trends in the industry. Only after this step can a company design a customer-driven marketing strategy that meets the needs and wants of their target audience. Therefore, option D is the correct choice.
Option A is incorrect because determining how to deliver superior value to customers is a part of designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, which is step 2. Option B is incorrect because building profitable relationships with customers is step 4, after the marketing strategy has been designed. Option C is incorrect because customer relationship management (CRM) is a tool used to build and maintain customer relationships, which is step 4 in the marketing process. Option E is incorrect because constructing an integrated marketing program is step 3, which comes after designing a customer-driven marketing strategy. 

Câu hỏi 1205: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, which of the following is the final step in creating value for customers?
A) designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
B) understanding the marketplace and customer needs
C) constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value
D) building profitable relationships and creating customer delight
E) capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity
Câu trả lời 1205: The five-step model of the marketing process includes understanding the marketplace and customer needs, designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value, building profitable relationships and creating customer delight, and capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity.
The final step in the process is capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity. This involves creating a pricing strategy that allows the company to capture the value it has provided to customers while also creating a strong relationship with those customers that will lead to future purchases and loyalty. In this step, the company evaluates the effectiveness of its marketing efforts and adjusts its strategies based on customer feedback and market trends to continue to create value for its customers and capture value for itself. 

Câu hỏi 1206: When backed by buying power, wants become ________.
A) social needs
B) demands
C) physical needs
D) self-esteem needs
E) exchanges
Câu trả lời 1206: When a want is backed by buying power, it becomes a demand. A want is simply a desire or aspiration for something, but a demand is a want that is supported by the ability and willingness to pay for it. In other words, when someone has the financial resources and the willingness to spend those resources on a particular want, that want becomes a demand. For example, a person may want a new car, but it only becomes a demand when they have the financial means and the intention to purchase a new car. Therefore, the best choice to complete the sentence is option B) demands. 

Câu hỏi 1207: Which of the following terms refers to sellers being preoccupied with their own products and losing sight of underlying consumer needs?
A) vendor lock-in
B) social loafing
C) value proposition
D) marketing myopia
E) conspicuous consumption
Câu trả lời 1207: Marketing myopia is a term used to describe when sellers become overly focused on their own products and lose sight of the underlying needs and desires of consumers. This can lead to a failure to adapt to changing market conditions and consumer preferences, which can ultimately result in decreased sales and revenue. Other terms on the list have different meanings:
Vendor lock-in refers to a situation where a customer becomes dependent on a particular vendor's products or services and is therefore less likely to switch to another vendor.
Social loafing refers to the tendency for individuals to exert less effort when working in a group than when working alone.
Value proposition refers to the unique benefits that a product or service offers to consumers, which distinguish it from competitors.
Conspicuous consumption refers to the act of purchasing and displaying expensive goods or services in order to signal social status or wealth. 

Câu hỏi 1208: Refer to the scenario below to answer the following question(s).
Carol Veldt, owner of Seagull Terrace, watched her investment grow from a small, seaside motel to a thriving year-round resort in just a few years. Atop a cliff overlooking the Maine coast, Seagull Terrace had attracted thousands of visitors during summer, but then faced a tremendous downturn in business during winter. "But, given the established industries in the nearby towns, very little year-round competition, and our close proximity to Portland," Carol added, "I couldn't understand why seasonality had to hit Seagull Terrace so hard!"
So Carol spent her first winter devising a new marketing plan. She put together a promotional package designed to attract business travelers year-round. Carol's plan also involved a seasonal promotional gimmick-to be implemented from early winter to late spring-that would attract the same numbers as the large summer crowd. Her idea worked! During her second winter, Carol greeted numerous business travelers-both satisfied repeat guests as well as new guests who had been snagged by her promotional appeals.
"We still have a long way to go," Carol admitted. "Our delicatessen offers entrees that are a part of the local cuisine, but we'd like to expand that. We provide health club privileges off-site, but we'd like to eventually provide our own. These are goals I hope to achieve in a few years. Our first project, however, included a renovation of our guest rooms and I'm quite proud of the results." Carol then added, "Actually there are so many possibilities. With an indoor pool area, I will eventually offer weekend getaways throughout winter."
-Seagull Terrace offers its customers good accommodations, local delicacies, and amazing seaside views. The overall experience provided at the motel is a part of its ________.
A) market offering
B) target market
C) market segment
D) product positioning
E) marketing mix
Câu trả lời 1208: Market offering refers to the combination of products and services that a business offers to meet the needs of its target market. Seagull Terrace offers good accommodations, local delicacies, and amazing seaside views as part of its market offering. While target market, market segment, product positioning, and marketing mix are all important concepts in marketing, they do not fully capture the range of products and services that Seagull Terrace offers to its customers. 

Câu hỏi 1209: A(n) ________ is the set of actual and potential buyers of a product or service.
A) market
B) control group
C) subsidiary
D) focus group
E) audience
Câu trả lời 1209: A market is defined as the set of actual and potential buyers of a product or service. This includes all individuals or organizations that have a need or desire for the product or service and have the ability to purchase it. The market may also include individuals or organizations who are not currently purchasing the product or service, but have the potential to do so in the future. Therefore, option A is the best choice as it provides the most accurate definition of a market. Option B (control group) refers to a group in an experiment that is used for comparison purposes, option C (subsidiary) refers to a company that is controlled by another company, option D (focus group) refers to a group of individuals who are asked to provide feedback on a product or service, and option E (audience) refers to the group of people who are watching, listening to, or reading a particular piece of media or content. 

Câu hỏi 1210: Human needs are shaped by culture and individual personality.
Câu trả lời 1210: The answer of Human needs are shaped by culture and...

Câu hỏi 1211: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of ________.
A) disappointing loyal customers
B) having to use an outside-in rather than an inside-out perspective
C) failing to attract enough customers
D) failing to understand their customers' needs
E) incorrectly identifying a target market
Câu trả lời 1211: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, the marketer may convey a message to potential customers that the offering is not very good, leading them to look for alternatives. Customers may also perceive the product or service as being of low quality, which may make it difficult for the marketer to differentiate it from competitors. Additionally, setting low expectations may limit the potential revenue the offering can generate, as customers may not be willing to pay as much for something that they perceive to be of lower value. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic expectations for their offerings that accurately reflect their value proposition and meet the needs of their target market. When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, they may communicate a message that the product or service is not very valuable, which may result in potential customers looking elsewhere for a better option. Additionally, setting low expectations may also result in missed opportunities to differentiate the offering and position it more effectively in the marketplace. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic but compelling expectations that will attract and retain customers. 

Câu hỏi 1212: Which of the following is NOT an accurate description of modern marketing?
A) Marketing is the creation of value for customers.
B) Marketing involves managing profitable customer relationships.
C) Marketing emphasizes selling and advertising exclusively.
D) Marketing involves satisfying customers' needs.
E) Marketing is building value-laden exchange relationships with customers.
Câu trả lời 1212: Modern marketing is not solely focused on selling and advertising; it encompasses a broader approach that includes creating value, managing relationships, and satisfying customer needs.
