Câu hỏi 1558: Marketing is defined as a social and managerial process by which individuals and organizations obtain what they need and want through ________.
A) research and development
B) innovation and creativity
C) manufacturing efficiencies
D) value creation and exchange
E) sales and revenue creation
Câu trả lời 1558: Marketing is the process of creating value for customers and exchanging that value for their satisfaction. It involves identifying customer needs and wants, developing products and services that meet those needs and wants, and communicating the benefits of those products and services to the target audience. The ultimate goal of marketing is to create and maintain long-term customer relationships that result in repeat business and customer loyalty. While research and development, innovation and creativity, manufacturing efficiencies, and sales and revenue creation are important components of marketing, they are all ultimately geared towards creating value for customers and exchanging that value for customer satisfaction. 

Câu hỏi 1559: A ________ is some combination of products, services, information, or experiences provided to consumers to satisfy a need or want.
A) market offering
B) value proposition
C) brand positioning
D) market segment
E) market mix
Câu trả lời 1559: A market offering refers to a bundle of products, services, information, or experiences that are presented to consumers to fulfill a particular need or want. It is a package of value that a company provides to its target customers to create customer satisfaction and loyalty. Market offerings can be tangible goods, intangible services, digital products, or a combination of all. They can be customized according to the needs and preferences of different market segments. Market offerings are the core of a company's marketing strategy and are designed to meet the specific needs of the target market. 

Câu hỏi 1560: When are sellers most effective?
A) when they focus more on their specific products and services
B) when they focus more on the price of their products and services
C) when they focus more on the benefits and experiences produced by their products and services
D) when they focus more on where their products and services can be purchased
E) when they focus more on cost to produce the product or service
Câu trả lời 1560: Sellers are most effective when they focus more on the benefits and experiences produced by their products and services. Customers are generally looking for solutions to their problems or desires, and they are willing to pay for products or services that can provide those solutions. By highlighting the benefits and experiences that their products or services can provide, sellers can show customers how their offerings can meet their needs and improve their lives.
While it is important for sellers to have a good understanding of the price and cost of their products or services, focusing solely on these factors can be limiting. Customers are often willing to pay more for products or services that provide greater benefits or experiences. Similarly, while the availability of a product or service is important, focusing solely on where it can be purchased is unlikely to be the most effective approach for most sellers.
Overall, by emphasizing the benefits and experiences produced by their products or services, sellers can more effectively connect with customers and demonstrate the value of their offerings. 

Câu hỏi 1561: Marketing is managing profitable customer relationships.
Câu trả lời 1561: Marketing involves creating, communicating, and delivering value to customers, which helps in building and maintaining profitable relationships with them. 

Câu hỏi 1562: According to management guru Peter Drucker, "The aim of marketing is to ________."
A) maximize profits of the company
B) emphasize customer wants and not customer needs
C) make selling unnecessary
D) fulfill unrealistic customer expectations
E) sell products
Câu trả lời 1562: Peter Drucker was a management consultant, educator, and author who is considered to be the father of modern management. According to Drucker, the aim of marketing is to make selling unnecessary. This means that the goal of marketing is to understand and satisfy the needs and wants of customers so well that the product or service sells itself. By understanding and meeting the needs of customers, a company can build a loyal customer base and achieve long-term success. Drucker believed that marketing is a key driver of business success, and that companies must constantly innovate and adapt their marketing strategies to stay competitive. Maximizing profits, emphasizing customer wants over needs, and fulfilling unrealistic customer expectations are not the primary objectives of marketing, according to Drucker. While selling products is certainly an important part of the marketing process, it is not the ultimate goal. 

Câu hỏi 1563: Greg Williams now has the buying power to purchase the desktop computer that he has wanted for the last six months. Greg's want now has become a(n) ________.
A) need
B) necessity
C) demand
D) exchange
E) transaction
Câu trả lời 1563: The statement mentions that Greg has the buying power to purchase a desktop computer that he has wanted for the last six months. This indicates that Greg has developed a desire or willingness to buy a desktop computer, which is referred to as a demand in economics. Demand refers to the quantity of a product or service that consumers are willing and able to buy at a given price, over a specific period of time. Therefore, in this case, Greg's want for a desktop computer has translated into a demand, as he has the purchasing power to buy it. Options A, B, D, and E are not appropriate choices, as they do not accurately describe the situation presented in the statement. 

Câu hỏi 1564: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, a company should ________ before designing a customer-driven marketing strategy.
A) determine how to deliver superior value to customers
B) build profitable relationships with customers
C) use customer relationship management to create full partnerships with key customers
D) understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants
E) construct an integrated marketing program
Câu trả lời 1564: The five-step model of the marketing process includes the following steps:
Understanding the marketplace and customer needs and wants
Designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
Constructing an integrated marketing program
Building customer relationships
Capturing value from customers
The first step in the process is to understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants. This involves conducting market research, analyzing customer behavior and preferences, and identifying trends in the industry. Only after this step can a company design a customer-driven marketing strategy that meets the needs and wants of their target audience. Therefore, option D is the correct choice.
Option A is incorrect because determining how to deliver superior value to customers is a part of designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, which is step 2. Option B is incorrect because building profitable relationships with customers is step 4, after the marketing strategy has been designed. Option C is incorrect because customer relationship management (CRM) is a tool used to build and maintain customer relationships, which is step 4 in the marketing process. Option E is incorrect because constructing an integrated marketing program is step 3, which comes after designing a customer-driven marketing strategy. 

Câu hỏi 1565: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, which of the following is the final step in creating value for customers?
A) designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
B) understanding the marketplace and customer needs
C) constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value
D) building profitable relationships and creating customer delight
E) capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity
Câu trả lời 1565: The five-step model of the marketing process includes understanding the marketplace and customer needs, designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value, building profitable relationships and creating customer delight, and capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity.
The final step in the process is capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity. This involves creating a pricing strategy that allows the company to capture the value it has provided to customers while also creating a strong relationship with those customers that will lead to future purchases and loyalty. In this step, the company evaluates the effectiveness of its marketing efforts and adjusts its strategies based on customer feedback and market trends to continue to create value for its customers and capture value for itself. 

Câu hỏi 1566: When backed by buying power, wants become ________.
A) social needs
B) demands
C) physical needs
D) self-esteem needs
E) exchanges
Câu trả lời 1566: When a want is backed by buying power, it becomes a demand. A want is simply a desire or aspiration for something, but a demand is a want that is supported by the ability and willingness to pay for it. In other words, when someone has the financial resources and the willingness to spend those resources on a particular want, that want becomes a demand. For example, a person may want a new car, but it only becomes a demand when they have the financial means and the intention to purchase a new car. Therefore, the best choice to complete the sentence is option B) demands. 

Câu hỏi 1567: Which of the following terms refers to sellers being preoccupied with their own products and losing sight of underlying consumer needs?
A) vendor lock-in
B) social loafing
C) value proposition
D) marketing myopia
E) conspicuous consumption
Câu trả lời 1567: Marketing myopia is a term used to describe when sellers become overly focused on their own products and lose sight of the underlying needs and desires of consumers. This can lead to a failure to adapt to changing market conditions and consumer preferences, which can ultimately result in decreased sales and revenue. Other terms on the list have different meanings:
Vendor lock-in refers to a situation where a customer becomes dependent on a particular vendor's products or services and is therefore less likely to switch to another vendor.
Social loafing refers to the tendency for individuals to exert less effort when working in a group than when working alone.
Value proposition refers to the unique benefits that a product or service offers to consumers, which distinguish it from competitors.
Conspicuous consumption refers to the act of purchasing and displaying expensive goods or services in order to signal social status or wealth. 

Câu hỏi 1568: Refer to the scenario below to answer the following question(s).
Carol Veldt, owner of Seagull Terrace, watched her investment grow from a small, seaside motel to a thriving year-round resort in just a few years. Atop a cliff overlooking the Maine coast, Seagull Terrace had attracted thousands of visitors during summer, but then faced a tremendous downturn in business during winter. "But, given the established industries in the nearby towns, very little year-round competition, and our close proximity to Portland," Carol added, "I couldn't understand why seasonality had to hit Seagull Terrace so hard!"
So Carol spent her first winter devising a new marketing plan. She put together a promotional package designed to attract business travelers year-round. Carol's plan also involved a seasonal promotional gimmick-to be implemented from early winter to late spring-that would attract the same numbers as the large summer crowd. Her idea worked! During her second winter, Carol greeted numerous business travelers-both satisfied repeat guests as well as new guests who had been snagged by her promotional appeals.
"We still have a long way to go," Carol admitted. "Our delicatessen offers entrees that are a part of the local cuisine, but we'd like to expand that. We provide health club privileges off-site, but we'd like to eventually provide our own. These are goals I hope to achieve in a few years. Our first project, however, included a renovation of our guest rooms and I'm quite proud of the results." Carol then added, "Actually there are so many possibilities. With an indoor pool area, I will eventually offer weekend getaways throughout winter."
-Seagull Terrace offers its customers good accommodations, local delicacies, and amazing seaside views. The overall experience provided at the motel is a part of its ________.
A) market offering
B) target market
C) market segment
D) product positioning
E) marketing mix
Câu trả lời 1568: Market offering refers to the combination of products and services that a business offers to meet the needs of its target market. Seagull Terrace offers good accommodations, local delicacies, and amazing seaside views as part of its market offering. While target market, market segment, product positioning, and marketing mix are all important concepts in marketing, they do not fully capture the range of products and services that Seagull Terrace offers to its customers. 

Câu hỏi 1569: A(n) ________ is the set of actual and potential buyers of a product or service.
A) market
B) control group
C) subsidiary
D) focus group
E) audience
Câu trả lời 1569: A market is defined as the set of actual and potential buyers of a product or service. This includes all individuals or organizations that have a need or desire for the product or service and have the ability to purchase it. The market may also include individuals or organizations who are not currently purchasing the product or service, but have the potential to do so in the future. Therefore, option A is the best choice as it provides the most accurate definition of a market. Option B (control group) refers to a group in an experiment that is used for comparison purposes, option C (subsidiary) refers to a company that is controlled by another company, option D (focus group) refers to a group of individuals who are asked to provide feedback on a product or service, and option E (audience) refers to the group of people who are watching, listening to, or reading a particular piece of media or content. 

Câu hỏi 1570: Human needs are shaped by culture and individual personality.
Câu trả lời 1570: The answer of Human needs are shaped by culture and...

Câu hỏi 1571: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of ________.
A) disappointing loyal customers
B) having to use an outside-in rather than an inside-out perspective
C) failing to attract enough customers
D) failing to understand their customers' needs
E) incorrectly identifying a target market
Câu trả lời 1571: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, the marketer may convey a message to potential customers that the offering is not very good, leading them to look for alternatives. Customers may also perceive the product or service as being of low quality, which may make it difficult for the marketer to differentiate it from competitors. Additionally, setting low expectations may limit the potential revenue the offering can generate, as customers may not be willing to pay as much for something that they perceive to be of lower value. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic expectations for their offerings that accurately reflect their value proposition and meet the needs of their target market. When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, they may communicate a message that the product or service is not very valuable, which may result in potential customers looking elsewhere for a better option. Additionally, setting low expectations may also result in missed opportunities to differentiate the offering and position it more effectively in the marketplace. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic but compelling expectations that will attract and retain customers. 

Câu hỏi 1572: Which of the following is NOT an accurate description of modern marketing?
A) Marketing is the creation of value for customers.
B) Marketing involves managing profitable customer relationships.
C) Marketing emphasizes selling and advertising exclusively.
D) Marketing involves satisfying customers' needs.
E) Marketing is building value-laden exchange relationships with customers.
Câu trả lời 1572: Modern marketing is not solely focused on selling and advertising; it encompasses a broader approach that includes creating value, managing relationships, and satisfying customer needs. 

Câu hỏi 1573: Needs include all of the following EXCEPT ________.
A) food
B) knowledge
C) affection
D) the newest iphone
E) belonging
Câu trả lời 1573: The newest iPhone is not a need, but a want. 

Câu hỏi 1574: The difference between human needs and wants is that needs are not created by marketers.
Câu trả lời 1574: Human needs are basic requirements for survival and well-being, such as food, water, and shelter, and exist independently of marketing efforts. Wants, however, are shaped by culture, society, and marketing, reflecting desires for specific products or services. 

Câu hỏi 1575: ________ is the act of obtaining a desired object from someone by offering something in return.
A) Valuation
B) Exchange
C) Market offering
D) Confiscation
E) Donation
Câu trả lời 1575: Exchange is the act of obtaining a desired object from someone by offering something in return. It is a fundamental concept in economics and is the basis for market transactions. In an exchange, both parties believe that they will benefit from the transaction, otherwise, they would not engage in it. The other options, such as valuation, confiscation, and donation, do not involve the mutual agreement and consent of both parties and therefore do not constitute an exchange. Market offering refers to the products or services being offered for sale in a marketplace, but it is not the same as the act of exchange itself. 

Câu hỏi 1576: Consumer research, product development, communication, distribution, pricing, and service are all core ________ activities.
A) positioning
B) marketing
C) outsourcing
D) production
E) logistics
Câu trả lời 1576: Consumer research, product development, communication, distribution, pricing, and service are all core marketing activities. Marketing is the process of identifying, anticipating, and satisfying customer needs and wants through the creation, promotion, and distribution of goods and services. The six activities listed are fundamental components of the marketing mix, which is the set of tactical tools that marketers use to create a desired response from their target market.
Positioning refers to the process of creating a distinctive image or identity for a product or brand in the minds of consumers. Outsourcing refers to the practice of hiring an external company to perform a business function that is normally done in-house. Production refers to the process of creating goods or services. Logistics refers to the process of managing the flow of goods from the point of origin to the point of consumption. While all of these activities may be important for a business, they are not considered core marketing activities. 

Câu hỏi 1577: ________ are human needs that are shaped by culture and individual personality.
A) Necessities
B) Wants
C) Demands
D) Values
E) Exchanges
Câu trả lời 1577: Wants are human needs that are influenced and shaped by cultural and individual factors, distinguishing them from basic necessities. 

Câu hỏi 1578: Marketing is defined as a social and managerial process by which individuals and organizations obtain what they need and want through ________.
A) research and development
B) innovation and creativity
C) manufacturing efficiencies
D) value creation and exchange
E) sales and revenue creation
Câu trả lời 1578: Marketing is the process of creating value for customers and exchanging that value for their satisfaction. It involves identifying customer needs and wants, developing products and services that meet those needs and wants, and communicating the benefits of those products and services to the target audience. The ultimate goal of marketing is to create and maintain long-term customer relationships that result in repeat business and customer loyalty. While research and development, innovation and creativity, manufacturing efficiencies, and sales and revenue creation are important components of marketing, they are all ultimately geared towards creating value for customers and exchanging that value for customer satisfaction.

D) market segment

Câu trả lời 1579: A market offering refers to a bundle of products, services, information, or experiences that are presented to consumers to fulfill a particular need or want. Market offerings are the core of a company's marketing strategy and are designed to meet the specific needs of the target market.

Câu hỏi 1585: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, which of the following is the final step in creating value for customers?
A) designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
B) understanding the marketplace and customer needs
C) constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value
D) building profitable relationships and creating customer delight
E) capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity
Câu trả lời 1585: The five-step model of the marketing process includes understanding the marketplace and customer needs, designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value, building profitable relationships and creating customer delight, and capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity.

Câu hỏi 1591: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of ________.

B) having to use an outside-in rather than an inside-out perspective
C) failing to attract enough customers
D) failing to understand their customers' needs
E) incorrectly identifying a target market

Câu trả lời 1593: The newest iPhone is not a need, but a want. 

Câu hỏi 1594: The difference between human needs and wants is that needs are not created by marketers.
Câu trả lời 1594: Human needs are basic requirements for survival and well-being, such as food, water, and shelter, and exist independently of marketing efforts. Wants, however, are shaped by culture, society, and marketing, reflecting desires for specific products or services. 

Câu hỏi 1595: ________ is the act of obtaining a desired object from someone by offering something in return.
A) Valuation
B) Exchange
C) Market offering
D) Confiscation
E) Donation
Câu trả lời 1595: Exchange is the act of obtaining a desired object from someone by offering something in return. It is a fundamental concept in economics and is the basis for market transactions. In an exchange, both parties believe that they will benefit from the transaction, otherwise, they would not engage in it. The other options, such as valuation, confiscation, and donation, do not involve the mutual agreement and consent of both parties and therefore do not constitute an exchange. Market offering refers to the products or services being offered for sale in a marketplace, but it is not the same as the act of exchange itself. 

Câu hỏi 1596: Consumer research, product development, communication, distribution, pricing, and service are all core ________ activities.
A) positioning
B) marketing
C) outsourcing
D) production
E) logistics
Câu trả lời 1596: Consumer research, product development, communication, distribution, pricing, and service are all core marketing activities. Marketing is the process of identifying, anticipating, and satisfying customer needs and wants through the creation, promotion, and distribution of goods and services. The six activities listed are fundamental components of the marketing mix, which is the set of tactical tools that marketers use to create a desired response from their target market.
Positioning refers to the process of creating a distinctive image or identity for a product or brand in the minds of consumers. Outsourcing refers to the practice of hiring an external company to perform a business function that is normally done in-house. Production refers to the process of creating goods or services. Logistics refers to the process of managing the flow of goods from the point of origin to the point of consumption. While all of these activities may be important for a business, they are not considered core marketing activities. 

Câu hỏi 1597: ________ are human needs that are shaped by culture and individual personality.
A) Necessities
B) Wants
C) Demands
D) Values
E) Exchanges
Câu trả lời 1597: Wants are human needs that are influenced and shaped by cultural and individual factors, distinguishing them from basic necessities. 

Câu hỏi 1598: Marketing is defined as a social and managerial process by which individuals and organizations obtain what they need and want through ________.
A) research and development
B) innovation and creativity
C) manufacturing efficiencies
D) value creation and exchange
E) sales and revenue creation
Câu trả lời 1598: Marketing is the process of creating value for customers and exchanging that value for their satisfaction. It involves identifying customer needs and wants, developing products and services that meet those needs and wants, and communicating the benefits of those products and services to the target audience. The ultimate goal of marketing is to create and maintain long-term customer relationships that result in repeat business and customer loyalty. While research and development, innovation and creativity, manufacturing efficiencies, and sales and revenue creation are important components of marketing, they are all ultimately geared towards creating value for customers and exchanging that value for customer satisfaction. 

Câu hỏi 1599: A ________ is some combination of products, services, information, or experiences provided to consumers to satisfy a need or want.
A) market offering
B) value proposition
C) brand positioning
D) market segment
E) market mix
Câu trả lời 1599: A market offering refers to a bundle of products, services, information, or experiences that are presented to consumers to fulfill a particular need or want. It is a package of value that a company provides to its target customers to create customer satisfaction and loyalty. Market offerings can be tangible goods, intangible services, digital products, or a combination of all. They can be customized according to the needs and preferences of different market segments. Market offerings are the core of a company's marketing strategy and are designed to meet the specific needs of the target market. 

Câu hỏi 1600: When are sellers most effective?
A) when they focus more on their specific products and services
B) when they focus more on the price of their products and services
C) when they focus more on the benefits and experiences produced by their products and services
D) when they focus more on where their products and services can be purchased
E) when they focus more on cost to produce the product or service
Câu trả lời 1600: Sellers are most effective when they focus more on the benefits and experiences produced by their products and services. Customers are generally looking for solutions to their problems or desires, and they are willing to pay for products or services that can provide those solutions. By highlighting the benefits and experiences that their products or services can provide, sellers can show customers how their offerings can meet their needs and improve their lives.
While it is important for sellers to have a good understanding of the price and cost of their products or services, focusing solely on these factors can be limiting. Customers are often willing to pay more for products or services that provide greater benefits or experiences. Similarly, while the availability of a product or service is important, focusing solely on where it can be purchased is unlikely to be the most effective approach for most sellers.
Overall, by emphasizing the benefits and experiences produced by their products or services, sellers can more effectively connect with customers and demonstrate the value of their offerings. 

Câu hỏi 1601: Marketing is managing profitable customer relationships.
Câu trả lời 1601: Marketing involves creating, communicating, and delivering value to customers, which helps in building and maintaining profitable relationships with them. 

Câu hỏi 1602: According to management guru Peter Drucker, "The aim of marketing is to ________."
A) maximize profits of the company
B) emphasize customer wants and not customer needs
C) make selling unnecessary
D) fulfill unrealistic customer expectations
E) sell products
Câu trả lời 1602: Peter Drucker was a management consultant, educator, and author who is considered to be the father of modern management. According to Drucker, the aim of marketing is to make selling unnecessary. This means that the goal of marketing is to understand and satisfy the needs and wants of customers so well that the product or service sells itself. By understanding and meeting the needs of customers, a company can build a loyal customer base and achieve long-term success. Drucker believed that marketing is a key driver of business success, and that companies must constantly innovate and adapt their marketing strategies to stay competitive. Maximizing profits, emphasizing customer wants over needs, and fulfilling unrealistic customer expectations are not the primary objectives of marketing, according to Drucker. While selling products is certainly an important part of the marketing process, it is not the ultimate goal. 

Câu hỏi 1603: Greg Williams now has the buying power to purchase the desktop computer that he has wanted for the last six months. Greg's want now has become a(n) ________.
A) need
B) necessity
C) demand
D) exchange
E) transaction
Câu trả lời 1603: The statement mentions that Greg has the buying power to purchase a desktop computer that he has wanted for the last six months. This indicates that Greg has developed a desire or willingness to buy a desktop computer, which is referred to as a demand in economics. Demand refers to the quantity of a product or service that consumers are willing and able to buy at a given price, over a specific period of time. Therefore, in this case, Greg's want for a desktop computer has translated into a demand, as he has the purchasing power to buy it. Options A, B, D, and E are not appropriate choices, as they do not accurately describe the situation presented in the statement. 

Câu hỏi 1604: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, a company should ________ before designing a customer-driven marketing strategy.
A) determine how to deliver superior value to customers
B) build profitable relationships with customers
C) use customer relationship management to create full partnerships with key customers
D) understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants
E) construct an integrated marketing program
Câu trả lời 1604: The five-step model of the marketing process includes the following steps:
Understanding the marketplace and customer needs and wants
Designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
Constructing an integrated marketing program
Building customer relationships
Capturing value from customers
The first step in the process is to understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants. This involves conducting market research, analyzing customer behavior and preferences, and identifying trends in the industry. Only after this step can a company design a customer-driven marketing strategy that meets the needs and wants of their target audience. Therefore, option D is the correct choice.
Option A is incorrect because determining how to deliver superior value to customers is a part of designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, which is step 2. Option B is incorrect because building profitable relationships with customers is step 4, after the marketing strategy has been designed. Option C is incorrect because customer relationship management (CRM) is a tool used to build and maintain customer relationships, which is step 4 in the marketing process. Option E is incorrect because constructing an integrated marketing program is step 3, which comes after designing a customer-driven marketing strategy. 

Câu hỏi 1605: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, which of the following is the final step in creating value for customers?
A) designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
B) understanding the marketplace and customer needs
C) constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value
D) building profitable relationships and creating customer delight
E) capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity
Câu trả lời 1605: The five-step model of the marketing process includes understanding the marketplace and customer needs, designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value, building profitable relationships and creating customer delight, and capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity.
The final step in the process is capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity. This involves creating a pricing strategy that allows the company to capture the value it has provided to customers while also creating a strong relationship with those customers that will lead to future purchases and loyalty. In this step, the company evaluates the effectiveness of its marketing efforts and adjusts its strategies based on customer feedback and market trends to continue to create value for its customers and capture value for itself. 

Câu hỏi 1606: When backed by buying power, wants become ________.
A) social needs
B) demands
C) physical needs
D) self-esteem needs
E) exchanges
Câu trả lời 1606: When a want is backed by buying power, it becomes a demand. A want is simply a desire or aspiration for something, but a demand is a want that is supported by the ability and willingness to pay for it. In other words, when someone has the financial resources and the willingness to spend those resources on a particular want, that want becomes a demand. For example, a person may want a new car, but it only becomes a demand when they have the financial means and the intention to purchase a new car. Therefore, the best choice to complete the sentence is option B) demands. 

Câu hỏi 1607: Which of the following terms refers to sellers being preoccupied with their own products and losing sight of underlying consumer needs?
A) vendor lock-in
B) social loafing
C) value proposition
D) marketing myopia
E) conspicuous consumption
Câu trả lời 1607: Marketing myopia is a term used to describe when sellers become overly focused on their own products and lose sight of the underlying needs and desires of consumers. This can lead to a failure to adapt to changing market conditions and consumer preferences, which can ultimately result in decreased sales and revenue. Other terms on the list have different meanings:
Vendor lock-in refers to a situation where a customer becomes dependent on a particular vendor's products or services and is therefore less likely to switch to another vendor.
Social loafing refers to the tendency for individuals to exert less effort when working in a group than when working alone.
Value proposition refers to the unique benefits that a product or service offers to consumers, which distinguish it from competitors.
Conspicuous consumption refers to the act of purchasing and displaying expensive goods or services in order to signal social status or wealth. 

Câu hỏi 1608: Refer to the scenario below to answer the following question(s).
Carol Veldt, owner of Seagull Terrace, watched her investment grow from a small, seaside motel to a thriving year-round resort in just a few years. Atop a cliff overlooking the Maine coast, Seagull Terrace had attracted thousands of visitors during summer, but then faced a tremendous downturn in business during winter. "But, given the established industries in the nearby towns, very little year-round competition, and our close proximity to Portland," Carol added, "I couldn't understand why seasonality had to hit Seagull Terrace so hard!"
So Carol spent her first winter devising a new marketing plan. She put together a promotional package designed to attract business travelers year-round. Carol's plan also involved a seasonal promotional gimmick-to be implemented from early winter to late spring-that would attract the same numbers as the large summer crowd. Her idea worked! During her second winter, Carol greeted numerous business travelers-both satisfied repeat guests as well as new guests who had been snagged by her promotional appeals.
"We still have a long way to go," Carol admitted. "Our delicatessen offers entrees that are a part of the local cuisine, but we'd like to expand that. We provide health club privileges off-site, but we'd like to eventually provide our own. These are goals I hope to achieve in a few years. Our first project, however, included a renovation of our guest rooms and I'm quite proud of the results." Carol then added, "Actually there are so many possibilities. With an indoor pool area, I will eventually offer weekend getaways throughout winter."
-Seagull Terrace offers its customers good accommodations, local delicacies, and amazing seaside views. The overall experience provided at the motel is a part of its ________.
A) market offering
B) target market
C) market segment
D) product positioning
E) marketing mix
Câu trả lời 1608: Market offering refers to the combination of products and services that a business offers to meet the needs of its target market. Seagull Terrace offers good accommodations, local delicacies, and amazing seaside views as part of its market offering. While target market, market segment, product positioning, and marketing mix are all important concepts in marketing, they do not fully capture the range of products and services that Seagull Terrace offers to its customers. 

Câu hỏi 1609: A(n) ________ is the set of actual and potential buyers of a product or service.
A) market
B) control group
C) subsidiary
D) focus group
E) audience
Câu trả lời 1609: A market is defined as the set of actual and potential buyers of a product or service. This includes all individuals or organizations that have a need or desire for the product or service and have the ability to purchase it. The market may also include individuals or organizations who are not currently purchasing the product or service, but have the potential to do so in the future. Therefore, option A is the best choice as it provides the most accurate definition of a market. Option B (control group) refers to a group in an experiment that is used for comparison purposes, option C (subsidiary) refers to a company that is controlled by another company, option D (focus group) refers to a group of individuals who are asked to provide feedback on a product or service, and option E (audience) refers to the group of people who are watching, listening to, or reading a particular piece of media or content. 

Câu hỏi 1610: Human needs are shaped by culture and individual personality.
Câu trả lời 1610: The answer of Human needs are shaped by culture and...

Câu hỏi 1611: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of ________.
A) disappointing loyal customers
B) having to use an outside-in rather than an inside-out perspective
C) failing to attract enough customers
D) failing to understand their customers' needs
E) incorrectly identifying a target market
Câu trả lời 1611: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, the marketer may convey a message to potential customers that the offering is not very good, leading them to look for alternatives. Customers may also perceive the product or service as being of low quality, which may make it difficult for the marketer to differentiate it from competitors. Additionally, setting low expectations may limit the potential revenue the offering can generate, as customers may not be willing to pay as much for something that they perceive to be of lower value. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic expectations for their offerings that accurately reflect their value proposition and meet the needs of their target market. When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, they may communicate a message that the product or service is not very valuable, which may result in potential customers looking elsewhere for a better option. Additionally, setting low expectations may also result in missed opportunities to differentiate the offering and position it more effectively in the marketplace. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic but compelling expectations that will attract and retain customers. 

Câu hỏi 1612: Which of the following is NOT an accurate description of modern marketing?
A) Marketing is the creation of value for customers.
B) Marketing involves managing profitable customer relationships.
C) Marketing emphasizes selling and advertising exclusively.
D) Marketing involves satisfying customers' needs.
E) Marketing is building value-laden exchange relationships with customers.
Câu trả lời 1612: Modern marketing is not solely focused on selling and advertising; it encompasses a broader approach that includes creating value, managing relationships, and satisfying customer needs. 

Câu hỏi 1613: Needs include all of the following EXCEPT ________.
A) food
B) knowledge
C) affection
D) the newest iphone
E) belonging
Câu trả lời 1613: The newest iPhone is not a need, but a want.

A) Valuation
B) Exchange
C) Market offering
D) Confiscation
E) Donation
Câu trả lời 1615: Exchange is the act of obtaining a desired object from someone by offering something in return. It is a fundamental concept in economics and is the basis for market transactions. In an exchange, both parties believe that they will benefit from the transaction, otherwise, they would not engage in it. The other options, such as valuation, confiscation, and donation, do not involve the mutual agreement and consent of both parties and therefore do not constitute an exchange. Market offering refers to the products or services being offered for sale in a marketplace, but it is not the same as the act of exchange itself.

A) positioning
B) marketing
C) outsourcing
D) production
E) logistics

Marketing is the process of identifying, anticipating, and satisfying customer needs and wants through the creation, promotion, and distribution of goods and services. D) understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants
E) construct an integrated marketing program

Option C is incorrect because customer relationship management (CRM) is a tool used to build and maintain customer relationships, which is step 4 in the marketing process. Option E is incorrect because constructing an integrated marketing program is step 3, which comes after designing a customer-driven marketing strategy. 

Câu hỏi 1625: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, which of the following is the final step in creating value for customers?
A) designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
B) understanding the marketplace and customer needs
C) constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value
D) building profitable relationships and creating customer delight
E) capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity
Câu trả lời 1625: The five-step model of the marketing process includes understanding the marketplace and customer needs, designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value, building profitable relationships and creating customer delight, and capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity.
The final step in the process is capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity. This involves creating a pricing strategy that allows the company to capture the value it has provided to customers while also creating a strong relationship with those customers that will lead to future purchases and loyalty. In this step, the company evaluates the effectiveness of its marketing efforts and adjusts its strategies based on customer feedback and market trends to continue to create value for its customers and capture value for itself.

A) social needs
B) demands
C) physical needs
D) self-esteem needs
E) exchanges

In other words, when someone has the financial resources and the willingness to spend those resources on a particular want, that want becomes a demand. For example, a person may want a new car, but it only becomes a demand when they have the financial means and the intention to purchase a new car. Therefore, the best choice to complete the sentence is option B) demands.

Câu hỏi 1628: Refer to the scenario below to answer the following question(s).
Carol Veldt, owner of Seagull Terrace, watched her investment grow from a small, seaside motel to a thriving year-round resort in just a few years. Atop a cliff overlooking the Maine coast, Seagull Terrace had attracted thousands of visitors during summer, but then faced a tremendous downturn in business during winter. "But, given the established industries in the nearby towns, very little year-round competition, and our close proximity to Portland," Carol added, "I couldn't understand why seasonality had to hit Seagull Terrace so hard!"
So Carol spent her first winter devising a new marketing plan. She put together a promotional package designed to attract business travelers year-round. Carol's plan also involved a seasonal promotional gimmick-to be implemented from early winter to late spring-that would attract the same numbers as the large summer crowd. Her idea worked! During her second winter, Carol greeted numerous business travelers-both satisfied repeat guests as well as new guests who had been snagged by her promotional appeals.
"We still have a long way to go," Carol admitted. "Our delicatessen offers entrees that are a part of the local cuisine, but we'd like to expand that. We provide health club privileges off-site, but we'd like to eventually provide our own. These are goals I hope to achieve in a few years. Our first project, however, included a renovation of our guest rooms and I'm quite proud of the results." Carol then added, "Actually there are so many possibilities. With an indoor pool area, I will eventually offer weekend getaways throughout winter."

A) market offering
B) target market
C) market segment
D) product positioning
E) marketing mix

Câu hỏi 1629: A(n) ________ is the set of actual and potential buyers of a product or service.
A) market
B) control group
C) subsidiary
D) focus group
E) audience
Câu trả lời 1629: A market is defined as the set of actual and potential buyers of a product or service. This includes all individuals or organizations that have a need or desire for the product or service and have the ability to purchase it. The market may also include individuals or organizations who are not currently purchasing the product or service, but have the potential to do so in the future. Therefore, option A is the best choice as it provides the most accurate definition of a market. Option B (control group) refers to a group in an experiment that is used for comparison purposes, option C (subsidiary) refers to a company that is controlled by another company, option D (focus group) refers to a group of individuals who are asked to provide feedback on a product or service, and option E (audience) refers to the group of people who are watching, listening to, or reading a particular piece of media or content. 

Câu hỏi 1630: Human needs are shaped by culture and individual personality.
Câu trả lời 1630: The answer of Human needs are shaped by culture and...

Câu hỏi 1631: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of ________.
A) disappointing loyal customers
B) having to use an outside-in rather than an inside-out perspective
C) failing to attract enough customers
D) failing to understand their customers' needs
E) incorrectly identifying a target market
Câu trả lời 1631: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, the marketer may convey a message to potential customers that the offering is not very good, leading them to look for alternatives. Customers may also perceive the product or service as being of low quality, which may make it difficult for the marketer to differentiate it from competitors. Additionally, setting low expectations may limit the potential revenue the offering can generate, as customers may not be willing to pay as much for something that they perceive to be of lower value. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic expectations for their offerings that accurately reflect their value proposition and meet the needs of their target market. When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, they may communicate a message that the product or service is not very valuable, which may result in potential customers looking elsewhere for a better option. Additionally, setting low expectations may also result in missed opportunities to differentiate the offering and position it more effectively in the marketplace. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic but compelling expectations that will attract and retain customers. 

Câu hỏi 1632: Which of the following is NOT an accurate description of modern marketing?
A) Marketing is the creation of value for customers.
B) Marketing involves managing profitable customer relationships.
C) Marketing emphasizes selling and advertising exclusively.
D) Marketing involves satisfying customers' needs.
E) Marketing is building value-laden exchange relationships with customers.
Câu trả lời 1632: Modern marketing is not solely focused on selling and advertising; it encompasses a broader approach that includes creating value, managing relationships, and satisfying customer needs. 

Câu hỏi 1633: Needs include all of the following EXCEPT ________.
A) food
B) knowledge
C) affection
D) the newest iphone
E) belonging
Câu trả lời 1633: The newest iPhone is not a need, but a want. 

Câu hỏi 1634: The difference between human needs and wants is that needs are not created by marketers.
Câu trả lời 1634: Human needs are basic requirements for survival and well-being, such as food, water, and shelter, and exist independently of marketing efforts. Wants, however, are shaped by culture, society, and marketing, reflecting desires for specific products or services. 

Câu hỏi 1635: ________ is the act of obtaining a desired object from someone by offering something in return.
A) Valuation
B) Exchange
C) Market offering
D) Confiscation
E) Donation
Câu trả lời 1635: Exchange is the act of obtaining a desired object from someone by offering something in return. It is a fundamental concept in economics and is the basis for market transactions. In an exchange, both parties believe that they will benefit from the transaction, otherwise, they would not engage in it. The other options, such as valuation, confiscation, and donation, do not involve the mutual agreement and consent of both parties and therefore do not constitute an exchange. Market offering refers to the products or services being offered for sale in a marketplace, but it is not the same as the act of exchange itself. 

Câu hỏi 1636: Consumer research, product development, communication, distribution, pricing, and service are all core ________ activities.
A) positioning
B) marketing
C) outsourcing
D) production
E) logistics
Câu trả lời 1636: Consumer research, product development, communication, distribution, pricing, and service are all core marketing activities. Marketing is the process of identifying, anticipating, and satisfying customer needs and wants through the creation, promotion, and distribution of goods and services. The six activities listed are fundamental components of the marketing mix, which is the set of tactical tools that marketers use to create a desired response from their target market.
Positioning refers to the process of creating a distinctive image or identity for a product or brand in the minds of consumers. Outsourcing refers to the practice of hiring an external company to perform a business function that is normally done in-house. Production refers to the process of creating goods or services. Logistics refers to the process of managing the flow of goods from the point of origin to the point of consumption. While all of these activities may be important for a business, they are not considered core marketing activities. 

Câu hỏi 1637: ________ are human needs that are shaped by culture and individual personality.
A) Necessities
B) Wants
C) Demands
D) Values
E) Exchanges
Câu trả lời 1637: Wants are human needs that are influenced and shaped by cultural and individual factors, distinguishing them from basic necessities. 

Câu hỏi 1638: Marketing is defined as a social and managerial process by which individuals and organizations obtain what they need and want through ________.
A) research and development
B) innovation and creativity
C) manufacturing efficiencies
D) value creation and exchange
E) sales and revenue creation
Câu trả lời 1638: Marketing is the process of creating value for customers and exchanging that value for their satisfaction. It involves identifying customer needs and wants, developing products and services that meet those needs and wants, and communicating the benefits of those products and services to the target audience. The ultimate goal of marketing is to create and maintain long-term customer relationships that result in repeat business and customer loyalty. While research and development, innovation and creativity, manufacturing efficiencies, and sales and revenue creation are important components of marketing, they are all ultimately geared towards creating value for customers and exchanging that value for customer satisfaction. 

Câu hỏi 1639: A ________ is some combination of products, services, information, or experiences provided to consumers to satisfy a need or want.
A) market offering
B) value proposition
C) brand positioning
D) market segment
E) market mix
Câu trả lời 1639: A market offering refers to a bundle of products, services, information, or experiences that are presented to consumers to fulfill a particular need or want. It is a package of value that a company provides to its target customers to create customer satisfaction and loyalty. Market offerings can be tangible goods, intangible services, digital products, or a combination of all. They can be customized according to the needs and preferences of different market segments. Market offerings are the core of a company's marketing strategy and are designed to meet the specific needs of the target market. 

Câu hỏi 1640: When are sellers most effective?
A) when they focus more on their specific products and services
B) when they focus more on the price of their products and services
C) when they focus more on the benefits and experiences produced by their products and services
D) when they focus more on where their products and services can be purchased
E) when they focus more on cost to produce the product or service
Câu trả lời 1640: Sellers are most effective when they focus more on the benefits and experiences produced by their products and services. Customers are generally looking for solutions to their problems or desires, and they are willing to pay for products or services that can provide those solutions. By highlighting the benefits and experiences that their products or services can provide, sellers can show customers how their offerings can meet their needs and improve their lives.
While it is important for sellers to have a good understanding of the price and cost of their products or services, focusing solely on these factors can be limiting. Customers are often willing to pay more for products or services that provide greater benefits or experiences. Similarly, while the availability of a product or service is important, focusing solely on where it can be purchased is unlikely to be the most effective approach for most sellers.
Overall, by emphasizing the benefits and experiences produced by their products or services, sellers can more effectively connect with customers and demonstrate the value of their offerings. 

Câu hỏi 1641: Marketing is managing profitable customer relationships.
Câu trả lời 1641: Marketing involves creating, communicating, and delivering value to customers, which helps in building and maintaining profitable relationships with them. 

Câu hỏi 1642: According to management guru Peter Drucker, "The aim of marketing is to ________."
A) maximize profits of the company
B) emphasize customer wants and not customer needs
C) make selling unnecessary
D) fulfill unrealistic customer expectations
E) sell products
Câu trả lời 1642: Peter Drucker was a management consultant, educator, and author who is considered to be the father of modern management. According to Drucker, the aim of marketing is to make selling unnecessary. This means that the goal of marketing is to understand and satisfy the needs and wants of customers so well that the product or service sells itself. By understanding and meeting the needs of customers, a company can build a loyal customer base and achieve long-term success. Drucker believed that marketing is a key driver of business success, and that companies must constantly innovate and adapt their marketing strategies to stay competitive. Maximizing profits, emphasizing customer wants over needs, and fulfilling unrealistic customer expectations are not the primary objectives of marketing, according to Drucker. While selling products is certainly an important part of the marketing process, it is not the ultimate goal. 

Câu hỏi 1643: Greg Williams now has the buying power to purchase the desktop computer that he has wanted for the last six months. Greg's want now has become a(n) ________.
A) need
B) necessity
C) demand
D) exchange
E) transaction
Câu trả lời 1643: The statement mentions that Greg has the buying power to purchase a desktop computer that he has wanted for the last six months. This indicates that Greg has developed a desire or willingness to buy a desktop computer, which is referred to as a demand in economics. Demand refers to the quantity of a product or service that consumers are willing and able to buy at a given price, over a specific period of time. Therefore, in this case, Greg's want for a desktop computer has translated into a demand, as he has the purchasing power to buy it. Options A, B, D, and E are not appropriate choices, as they do not accurately describe the situation presented in the statement. 

Câu hỏi 1644: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, a company should ________ before designing a customer-driven marketing strategy.
A) determine how to deliver superior value to customers
B) build profitable relationships with customers
C) use customer relationship management to create full partnerships with key customers
D) understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants
E) construct an integrated marketing program
Câu trả lời 1644: The five-step model of the marketing process includes the following steps:
Understanding the marketplace and customer needs and wants
Designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
Constructing an integrated marketing program
Building customer relationships
Capturing value from customers
The first step in the process is to understand the marketplace and customer needs and wants. This involves conducting market research, analyzing customer behavior and preferences, and identifying trends in the industry. Only after this step can a company design a customer-driven marketing strategy that meets the needs and wants of their target audience. Therefore, option D is the correct choice.
Option A is incorrect because determining how to deliver superior value to customers is a part of designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, which is step 2. Option B is incorrect because building profitable relationships with customers is step 4, after the marketing strategy has been designed. Option C is incorrect because customer relationship management (CRM) is a tool used to build and maintain customer relationships, which is step 4 in the marketing process. Option E is incorrect because constructing an integrated marketing program is step 3, which comes after designing a customer-driven marketing strategy. 

Câu hỏi 1645: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, which of the following is the final step in creating value for customers?
A) designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
B) understanding the marketplace and customer needs
C) constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value
D) building profitable relationships and creating customer delight
E) capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity
Câu trả lời 1645: The five-step model of the marketing process includes understanding the marketplace and customer needs, designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value, building profitable relationships and creating customer delight, and capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity.
The final step in the process is capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity. This involves creating a pricing strategy that allows the company to capture the value it has provided to customers while also creating a strong relationship with those customers that will lead to future purchases and loyalty. In this step, the company evaluates the effectiveness of its marketing efforts and adjusts its strategies based on customer feedback and market trends to continue to create value for its customers and capture value for itself. 

Câu hỏi 1646: When backed by buying power, wants become ________.
A) social needs
B) demands
C) physical needs
D) self-esteem needs
E) exchanges
Câu trả lời 1646: When a want is backed by buying power, it becomes a demand. A want is simply a desire or aspiration for something, but a demand is a want that is supported by the ability and willingness to pay for it. In other words, when someone has the financial resources and the willingness to spend those resources on a particular want, that want becomes a demand. For example, a person may want a new car, but it only becomes a demand when they have the financial means and the intention to purchase a new car. Therefore, the best choice to complete the sentence is option B) demands. 

Câu hỏi 1647: Which of the following terms refers to sellers being preoccupied with their own products and losing sight of underlying consumer needs?
A) vendor lock-in
B) social loafing
C) value proposition
D) marketing myopia
E) conspicuous consumption
Câu trả lời 1647: Marketing myopia is a term used to describe when sellers become overly focused on their own products and lose sight of the underlying needs and desires of consumers. This can lead to a failure to adapt to changing market conditions and consumer preferences, which can ultimately result in decreased sales and revenue. Other terms on the list have different meanings:
Vendor lock-in refers to a situation where a customer becomes dependent on a particular vendor's products or services and is therefore less likely to switch to another vendor.
Social loafing refers to the tendency for individuals to exert less effort when working in a group than when working alone.
Value proposition refers to the unique benefits that a product or service offers to consumers, which distinguish it from competitors.
Conspicuous consumption refers to the act of purchasing and displaying expensive goods or services in order to signal social status or wealth. 

Câu hỏi 1648: Refer to the scenario below to answer the following question(s).
Carol Veldt, owner of Seagull Terrace, watched her investment grow from a small, seaside motel to a thriving year-round resort in just a few years. Atop a cliff overlooking the Maine coast, Seagull Terrace had attracted thousands of visitors during summer, but then faced a tremendous downturn in business during winter. "But, given the established industries in the nearby towns, very little year-round competition, and our close proximity to Portland," Carol added, "I couldn't understand why seasonality had to hit Seagull Terrace so hard!"
So Carol spent her first winter devising a new marketing plan. She put together a promotional package designed to attract business travelers year-round. Carol's plan also involved a seasonal promotional gimmick-to be implemented from early winter to late spring-that would attract the same numbers as the large summer crowd. Her idea worked! During her second winter, Carol greeted numerous business travelers-both satisfied repeat guests as well as new guests who had been snagged by her promotional appeals.
"We still have a long way to go," Carol admitted. "Our delicatessen offers entrees that are a part of the local cuisine, but we'd like to expand that. We provide health club privileges off-site, but we'd like to eventually provide our own. These are goals I hope to achieve in a few years. Our first project, however, included a renovation of our guest rooms and I'm quite proud of the results." Carol then added, "Actually there are so many possibilities. With an indoor pool area, I will eventually offer weekend getaways throughout winter."
-Seagull Terrace offers its customers good accommodations, local delicacies, and amazing seaside views. The overall experience provided at the motel is a part of its ________.
A) market offering
B) target market
C) market segment
D) product positioning
E) marketing mix
Câu trả lời 1648: Market offering refers to the combination of products and services that a business offers to meet the needs of its target market. Seagull Terrace offers good accommodations, local delicacies, and amazing seaside views as part of its market offering. While target market, market segment, product positioning, and marketing mix are all important concepts in marketing, they do not fully capture the range of products and services that Seagull Terrace offers to its customers. 

Câu hỏi 1649: A(n) ________ is the set of actual and potential buyers of a product or service.
A) market
B) control group
C) subsidiary
D) focus group
E) audience
Câu trả lời 1649: A market is defined as the set of actual and potential buyers of a product or service. This includes all individuals or organizations that have a need or desire for the product or service and have the ability to purchase it. The market may also include individuals or organizations who are not currently purchasing the product or service, but have the potential to do so in the future. Therefore, option A is the best choice as it provides the most accurate definition of a market. Option B (control group) refers to a group in an experiment that is used for comparison purposes, option C (subsidiary) refers to a company that is controlled by another company, option D (focus group) refers to a group of individuals who are asked to provide feedback on a product or service, and option E (audience) refers to the group of people who are watching, listening to, or reading a particular piece of media or content.

Câu trả lời 1650: The answer of Human needs are shaped by culture and...

Câu hỏi 1651: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of ________.
A) disappointing loyal customers
B) having to use an outside-in rather than an inside-out perspective
C) failing to attract enough customers
D) failing to understand their customers' needs
E) incorrectly identifying a target market
Câu trả lời 1651: When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, the marketer may convey a message to potential customers that the offering is not very good, leading them to look for alternatives. Customers may also perceive the product or service as being of low quality, which may make it difficult for the marketer to differentiate it from competitors. Additionally, setting low expectations may limit the potential revenue the offering can generate, as customers may not be willing to pay as much for something that they perceive to be of lower value. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic expectations for their offerings that accurately reflect their value proposition and meet the needs of their target market. When marketers set low expectations for a market offering, they run the risk of failing to attract enough customers. By setting low expectations, they may communicate a message that the product or service is not very valuable, which may result in potential customers looking elsewhere for a better option. Additionally, setting low expectations may also result in missed opportunities to differentiate the offering and position it more effectively in the marketplace. Therefore, it is important for marketers to set realistic but compelling expectations that will attract and retain customers.

B) Exchange
C) Market offering
D) Confiscation
E) Donation

The other options, such as valuation, confiscation, and donation, do not involve the mutual agreement and consent of both parties and therefore do not constitute an exchange. Market offering refers to the products or services being offered for sale in a marketplace, but it is not the same as the act of exchange itself.

Câu hỏi 1665: According to the five-step model of the marketing process, which of the following is the final step in creating value for customers?
A) designing a customer-driven marketing strategy
B) understanding the marketplace and customer needs
C) constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value
D) building profitable relationships and creating customer delight
E) capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity
Câu trả lời 1665: The five-step model of the marketing process includes understanding the marketplace and customer needs, designing a customer-driven marketing strategy, constructing an integrated marketing program that delivers superior value, building profitable relationships and creating customer delight, and capturing value from customers to create profit and customer equity.

This involves creating a pricing strategy that allows the company to capture the value it has provided to customers while also creating a strong relationship with those customers that will lead to future purchases and loyalty. In this step, the company evaluates the effectiveness of its marketing efforts and adjusts its strategies based on customer feedback and market trends to continue to create value for its customers and capture value for itself.

Câu hỏi 1667: Which of the following terms refers to sellers being preoccupied with their own products and losing sight of underlying consumer needs?
A) vendor lock-in
B) social loafing
C) value proposition
D) marketing myopia
E) conspicuous consumption
